issueDTO.title: Allow passing config_path as a parameter to KubernetesExecutor
issueDTO.description:
### Description

Currently, when using executor_config with KubernetesExecutor, the config_file path must be hardcoded. If we try to pass it dynamically using a Jinja template ("{{ params.config_path }}"), it results in an error.

Example of a working static configuration:
```python
executor_config={"KubernetesExecutor": {"config_file": "/opt/airflow/config/kubernetes/docker-desktop-config.yaml"}}
```
However, if we attempt to pass it dynamically, it fails:
```python
executor_config={"KubernetesExecutor": {"config_file": "{{ params.config_path }}"}}
```
This would be useful when deploying DAGs across different environments (e.g., multiple regions) without hardcoding paths.

**Proposed Solution:**

Modify executor_config to allow templating in KubernetesExecutor.config_file, similar to other templated parameters in Airflow.

### Use case/motivation

This would be useful when deploying DAGs across different environments (e.g., multiple regions) without hardcoding paths.
Airflow should allow config_file to accept templated values, resolving them at runtime.
This feature would improve flexibility when running KubernetesExecutor tasks that need different configurations based on dynamic parameters.
Would love to hear thoughts from the community on this! Thanks! 😊

### Related issues


This feature would improve Airflow’s flexibility in hybrid execution environments and align with the goals of[ AIP-61](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AIRFLOW/AIP-61+Hybrid+Execution). Would love to hear thoughts from the community on this! 🚀

### Are you willing to submit a PR?

- [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
comments: Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template! If you are willing to raise PR to address this issue please do so, no need to wait for approval.

If you can take a look at propose a PR solving it, yes I think it would be useful. But it needs a deep look in the code whether it's possible, also with Airflow 3 changes / Task SDK changes in progress, likely doing it after this is completed, is a good idea.

Are you sure you can rewrite it with?
 ```
executor_config={"KubernetesExecutor": {"config_file": "/opt/airflow/config/kubernetes/docker-desktop-config.yaml"}}
```
I've dug through the code and also experimented a bit, and couldn't find any way to rewrite the initial config file for `KubernetesExecutor`. Am I missing something?  Any  of the `executor_config` I've tried to use with deprecated `KubernetesExecutor` variant except the empty one led to the error:
```
{kubernetes_executor.py:355} ERROR - Invalid executor_config for TaskInstanceKey
```

issueDTO.title: Make subview borders configurable
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Starting in `v7.10.0`, all subviews have a thin border/outline around them to make it easily distinguishable from other elements on the form. We have received feedback from some users that this is not always desirable, for instance when you have a subview within a larger subview, or when the headings clearly separate portions of the form. Some have mentioned they simply prefer the look without them and understand the implications of not clearly segmenting each table. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**

One of two solutions would be acceptable, with the first one being **preferred**.

1. Allow users to configure subview outlines in the XML, setting them to `true` or `false` via an attribute (e.g. `outline`). The default would be `true`.

2. Allow users to completely enable or disable subview outlines in User Preferences

**Reported By**
Marion at Museum für Naturkunde Berlin on the [Speciforum](https://discourse.specifysoftware.org/t/configureg-subview-border/2673)


>For example, in my form, I have the Determiners subview in the Determination subview. I wanted to remove the Determiners subview frame.
>
>![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d1fad119-1bf4-40e8-8876-d913033b153f)

Natalia at KU Invertebrate Paleontology

**Additional context**
This was requested by several users at the SPNHC 2025 workshop as well.
comments:
This issue has been mentioned on **Specify Community Forum**. There might be relevant details there:

https://discourse.specifysoftware.org/t/configuring-the-subview-border/2673/2

issueDTO.title: Add function_body_length to .swiftlint.yml
issueDTO.description:
Like it was done for `closure_body_length` add `function_body_length` to `.swiftlint.yml` with an high threshold in order to avoid a lot of warning. This task is an iterative one since the scope is to reduce the threshold and keep solving the lint issue gradually in small PRs.



┆Issue is synchronized with this [Jira Task](https://mozilla-hub.atlassian.net/browse/FXIOS-11340)
comments: cc @ionixjunior
Nice, @FilippoZazzeroni! Once I wrap up the `closure_body_length` saga, I’d like to take on this issue.
Yes sure @ionixjunior. Thanks so much 🎉 🎉

@FilippoZazzeroni I've been analyzing the `function_body_length` violations and here is a breakdown of the 147 current violations to help us decide on a starting point:

| Function size (lines) | Number of violations |
|--------|--------|
| 100 - 982 (biggest) | 21 |
| 90 - 99 | 9 |
| 80 - 89 | 13 |
| 70 - 79 | 23 |
| 60 - 69 | 38 | 
| 51 - 59 | 43 | 

The standard SwiftLint threshold is 50 lines. Based on this data, what do you think would be a realistic initial target for us to aim for? I believe this can be important to understand when this issue can be closed. Also, we could document this target in the issue's title or description.

Hi @ionixjunior sorry for answering late, i think we should do like we did with `closure_body_length`. We should first enforce the rule with a super high threshold that could be the lower value after the 982 line function and for each PR we lower the threshold.

issueDTO.title: [ui] - Fixing spacings in the comment section
issueDTO.description: > Do you have attention to detail and would like to work on making the UI nicer? This issue is then for you! :)) ## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe. 1. Comment section is still not matching the designs. The whitespace is lacking between the nested comments and the visually it looks tight, packed and overwhelming. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c6340e9d-7671-4308-acd0-10bf42bffd4b) 2. Additionally the comment on mobile has spacing from the left, leaving the space not being utilised and making the text unnecessarily squeezed. Especially with nested comments it becomes obvious: 3. If the comment has some enters for new line and the the Show more button shows, it creates an awkward space. There is also gap applied. ## Describe the solution you'd like Generally I think this will need not only adjusting the numbers, but some minor restructuring of the divs. So, let me try to number the improvements: --- 1. Improving the spacings between the nested comments. In the designs there are also the useful buttons in each comment, that are not yet implemented. In the design however, the spacing occurs naturally because of the useful buttons, so I did not need to add a big margin-bottom. I will leave the solution here up to you, but account for the fact that one day in the future we will introduce the useful button for the comment. Don't be afraid to be generous with the spacings, in the devtools i tried 50px as in my designs --- 2. Mobile improvement. Here I upload a gif of the solution that I utilised in the Figma designs - it was to hide the left column with the avatar, allowing the text to stretch and then showing the avatar next to the username in 30x30px size. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/329f7267-8bdb-4d18-a47c-73b7e44d5478) Don't forget to make sure that the author's badge is working --- 3. Putting the Show More button directly under the comment, trimming the whitespaces. --- 4. Decreasing the gap here to 5px from 10px --- 5. As you can see, on mobile it gets quite tight. I would suggest removing the word Published from the "Published x time ago" information for the comments. --- 6. OPTIONAL - In case you would want to act on the point 5. above even more, I would suggest for mobile screens shortening the formulation even more, saying for example 1h ago, 3mo ago or 2yr ago. Reddit does it this way as well. --- 7. OPTIONAL - In case you would still be up for a challenge, having these 2 aligned on the baseline would be a nice achievement, however I didn't manage to get the desired result, since as you can see below, the align-items:baseline does not align them. ## Additional context - [FIGMA FILE HERE](https://www.figma.com/design/XYV3fr8UVOdkNyBmKHHR7f/CP---Comments-Useful---Mobile?node-id=48-79) You can find the figma file above. You can see the components, the desktop and the mobile versions. These design include the correct answer feature or the useful buttons, which are not yet implemented, so feel free to ignore those. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask. :))
comments:
@benfurber - I can take this up!

Although, if we are adding margin to fill the space where the useful count will go for comments, is there any reason not to go and implement the useful counter for comments? I'd be happy to include that as well.

Heyy @JCSergent! Cool to see that you are up for tackling these design improvements. 

Just yesterday we were talking with Ben, that this issue was in his opinion hard to follow and that the screenshots I included could be a bit confusing (some of them with the useful button, some without), so I thought about rewriting it. Is the issue clear to you though? If so, than let's keep it and if you find anything even slightly unclear you can tag me in the comments at any time and I'll be happy to give more clarification. :))

Also Ben mentioned that he does not have the capacity to prioritise this at the moment, so this would actually be really really helpful and valuable contribution from you. <3

Ben was also wrote yesterday that some of the points I mentioned were implemented already. After checking, it was only the point 5. - removing the word "Published" from the timestamp.

I will ask the team about implementing the useful counter and let you know. :))

@dalibormrska  - I think I understand it, but here let me try to summarize and let me know if I am understanding your requests correctly.


Request 1: Increase spacing between the nested comments.
Solutions:
- Long Term Solution: Add the Useful Counter to comments which will naturally add whitespace between the comments
- Easier Solution: Manually add whitespace between the nested comments (which is the space the Useful Counter will take up later)

Request 2: When viewing comments (especially reply comments) in mobile, the comment text is extremely narrow.
Solution: Remove the left side margin (make the comment text and profile image be on the same vertical line). Use the smaller version of the profile picture. Basically try to get to this design:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a4045704-088e-4a7c-a7ff-bf3d1c5535b3)

Request 3: If a comment has alot of line breaks, there could be an awkward gap between the comment text and the 'Show more' button
Solution: Remove line breaks from the end of the comment when hiding the rest of the comment behind the 'Show more' button

Request 4: Decrease Gap between profile/upload date line and comment body from 10px to 5px
Solution: This is straight forward :), just decrease gap from 10px to 5px

Request 5: Remove the 'Published ... time ago' part of the upload date to save space
Solution: Already Done :)

Request 6 (OPTIONAL): The upload date still takes alot of space on mobile
Solution: Use time short hand in mobile. For example, use '5h ago' instead of '5 hours ago' or '4mo ago' instead of '4 months ago'

Request 7 (OPTIONAL): The user flag, user name, and upload date are not aligned
Solution: Align the 3 on the baseline

Cool, well summarised, it's pretty much spot-on. :)) The only thing that got trickier since then is the Request 4. If you run the project locally or are a beta-tester, you will see that now the three-dots menu next to the top-comment has been implemented. The three-dots button is huge however, which makes the whole header of the top-comment taller than the replies and therefore makes it hard to achieve consistent gap. I don't know however what makes the most sense from the coding best practices - but I imagine if you tackle the Request 2. and include the avatar image in the comment header, then the whole header will get the height of the image. I would then suggest trying to make the image size and the three-dots menu size the same - let's try 35x35px and adjusting the gap accordingly. Other than that we just wait for @benfurber to assign. :))

I'm sceptical of making the avatar too small, otherwise what's the point of showing it.

It's yours @JCSergent.

One thing to note, I'm about to implement some icon changes which includes the pointing down arrow in these screenshots.

issueDTO.title: VM Detection is not working on MacOS
issueDTO.description:
I am using Macbook Air M1 and inside that I am using UTM-MacOS-VM but its not detecting it as virtual machine.

UTM - https://mac.getutm.app/
comments:
@AdnanAhad Hi! thanks for the issue.

I’ve never heard of UTM-VM, and it’s not on our supported brand list but that doesn’t mean the lib shouldn’t work. Although you say it didn’t work, were there any techniques that says it detected? 

In the meantime, I’ll try to find something that could be used as a detection in UTM-VM, but there’s no guarantees. It’s a hard process and the codebase for that project is huge.

It’s also worth noting that MacOS techniques aren’t our speciality. Although we support it, we don’t really maintain it as Linux and Windows are the most demanded platforms for this sort of project.

@kernelwernel Thanks for the response, 


But I think I have found the solution for that, I have added one more check for detection of Hypervisor in MAC and it helped me.

`sysctl kern.hv_vmm_present` 

it helped me to detect UTM.

@AdnanAhad That’s incredibly useful to know, thanks! What does that command output for UTM exactly? I’d like to know so I can add an official new technique to the library. Credit will also be given obviously :)

repository.description: VM detection library and tool
repository.name: VMAware

summary.main: VM Detection is not working on MacOS when using UTM-MacOS-VM on a Macbook Air M1.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue is specific to VM Detection not working on MacOS, and it is a good first issue.
summary.attemptedFixes: The issue was solved by adding a new check for detection of Hypervisor in MAC using `sysctl kern.hv_vmm_present`.
summary.otherNotes: UTM-VM is not on the supported brand list but the issue is not specific to that. MacOS techniques are not the specialty of the project.

```
[DEBUG] HYPERVISOR_STR:
eax: 0
ebx: 0
ecx: 0
edx: 0
```
You can see in that all hypervisor registers are all zeroes.

I know that a normal hypervisor will return a bendstring when calling CPUID EAX=0x40000000. However, it is a bit strange to see that it is detected as a VM even though it is all 0.

..Maybe it's because of x86 emulating.

We've had issues with Microsoft discretely fiddling around with low-level stuff that it shouldn't modify and making them seem like it's a VM, so this isn't a new story for us but it's still important to address nonetheless. While I don't have a fix yet, we've previously encountered a very similar issue before (https://github.com/kernelwernel/VMAware/issues/359) and all we've done to fix it was by detecting binary translation environments and blacklisting (if found) for those specific techniques, and I'm pretty sure this is the path we'll take but I need to consult with my co-dev (@NotRequiem) who manages these techniques. I assume he's sleeping at the moment, but I'll let him know about the issue.

> You can see in that all hypervisor registers are all zeroes.

That technique isn't really relevant in this scenario, it's relatively common to have that output.

> I know that a normal hypervisor will return a bendstring when calling CPUID EAX=0x40000000. However, it is a bit strange to see that it is detected as a VM even though it is all 0.

I assume you meant "brand string" instead of bendstring, but this is also not surprising since it's a binary translator. I *assume* you have Microsoft PRISM doing the x86 to ARM translation, which isn't really accurate to call it an emulator in itself but that's besides the point.

A lot of funky stuff happens when the binary is being translated to a different ISA, but we still do our best to keep it as compatible as possible with the same core mechanisms we've done for real x86 hardware. We'll let you when there's a fix available.

I see now that the issue was more complex than I initially thought. It seems I was looking in the wrong direction. I would appreciate it if you could kindly let me know again if there are any revisions.

We'll make a new bug fix release right after fixing this issue, false positives are quite a severe problem to us no matter the circumstances. I'll definitely let you know when it's done (shouldn't take more than 2 days).

Ok, I'm awake now.

Your TPM manufacturer stands for "MSFT" (Microsoft), which is now whitelisted.

Your system does not contain any SSDT table, which is weird. Since there are no public dumps available of Microsoft Surface Pro 11 (as far as i know), I took dumps of other versions of Surface Pro devices to make that firmware check, specifically:
https://github.com/linuxhw/ACPI/blob/master/Tablet/Microsoft/Surface/Surface%20Laptop/4CA7E4FC50A4
https://github.com/linuxhw/ACPI/blob/master/Tablet/Microsoft/Surface/Surface%20Laptop%203/4E426AB8062D
https://github.com/linuxhw/ACPI/blob/master/Tablet/Microsoft/Surface/Surface%20Pro/773032238BB5
https://github.com/linuxhw/ACPI/blob/master/Tablet/Microsoft/Surface/Surface%20Pro%203/074C5C2E091B

I whitelisted Surface pro 11 devices from the SSDT check until i get more firmware dumps of those devices.

@heon0120

The TPM check should not flag now, but I need to know if you flag any other firmware heuristic, please run this .exe and share the results with us:
https://ufile.io/pzq5yzk6

Or compile from https://github.com/kernelwernel/VMAware/pull/451

issueDTO.title: Add a general delay between crawl requests
issueDTO.description:
### Problem Description

Currently users cannot configure a delay between crawl requests. A simple x seconds delay configurable from the yaml file would allow users to slow down crawls.

This is similar to https://github.com/elastic/crawler/issues/46 (abiding by `Crawl-delay` in robots.txt). However, a general delay would be useful for users who can't or don't want to change the robots.txt.

When both are implemented, the highest value of the two should be used for the crawl delay.

### Proposed Solution

Add a configurable crawl delay in yaml file.

### Additional Context

Link to discuss forum: https://discuss.elastic.co/t/apply-delay-between-requests-in-elastic-crawler/361375/4

summary.main: Add a general delay between crawl requests to allow users to slow down crawls and make it configurable from the yaml file.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The delay should be configurable from the yaml file, and the highest value of the two (crawl delay from robots.txt and the configurable delay) should be used for the crawl delay.
summary.attemptedFixes: None mentioned in the description or comments
summary.otherNotes: This issue is similar to https://github.com/elastic/crawler/issues/46 and aims to add a configurable delay between crawl requests in the yaml file, with the highest value of the two being used for the crawl delay.

issueDTO.title: Add `assertions_on_constants`
issueDTO.description:
# What it does

Checks for assert!(true) and assert!(false) calls.

# Why is this bad?

Should probably be replaced by a panic!() or removed

# Example

```cairo
assert!(false)
assert!(true)
const B: bool = false;
assert!(B)
```

issueDTO.title: Use XDG standard for directories
issueDTO.description:
### 🚀 Describe the new functionality needed

Currently, the project uses ~ (home directory) directly for storing configuration and data files. I propose we switch to following the [XDG Base Directory Specification](https://specifications.freedesktop.org/basedir-spec/basedir-spec-latest.html) because:
* Standardization: XDG paths are the standard across Linux and many Unix-like environments, improving consistency.
* Flexibility: Allows users to customize locations via environment variables (XDG_CONFIG_HOME, XDG_DATA_HOME), avoiding clutter in the home directory.
* Compatibility: Better aligns with modern best practices and other open-source tools.
* Cross-platform: Provides a clearer way to handle config/data locations on different OSes.

### 💡 Why is this needed? What if we don't build it?

Consistency!

### Other thoughts

_No response_

issueDTO.title: [Margin app] Create /signup endpoint (email only)
issueDTO.description:
## Guideline
1. Carefully read the issue description before applying to ensure you have all the necessary information to start working on it.
2. Write a brief description of how you will approach the task (without using ChatGPT).
3. Add your Telegram handler in your application (e.g., in OnlyDust or similar)
4. Write ETA in your application



## What should I do if I have a problem
1. Try to google it before asking. Googling is taking major part of dev work 
2. If you couldn't find answer your question with Google, text your question to [dev](https://t.me/spotnet_dev/4) group with your question.
3. Do not send DM to maintainer, it would be better and faster to ask other contributors in chat 


## How to prepare PR
1. Check if your code [smell](https://refactoring.guru/refactoring/smells) good
2.  Add `close #<issue number>` to link your issue with your PR
3.  Do not commit changes which is not related to your task 
4. Check after you created PR, if you committed everything.

## Task description  
1. Create a `POST /signup` endpoint that accepts only the user's email in the request body:
```json
{
  "email": "user@example.com"
}
```

2. Check if the email already exists in the database (e.g. pre-created by a super admin).
3. If valid, generate a JWT token that encodes the email.
4. Send a confirmation email with a link in the following format:

```python
f'{app_base_url}/signup-confirmation?token={token}'
```

5. Add `app_base_url` to your settings (if it's not already present).
6. Do not return any sensitive info in the response.
7. Add appropriate tests to cover:

   * New signup attempt
   * Already existing email
   * Proper link generation
   * Email delivery trigger

**NOTE: This refers to the admin entity**

Ensure no sensitive data is returned in the response.
Handling already existing email

issueDTO.title: 📦 App Packaging 📦
issueDTO.description:
(Still incomplete) TODO list about packaging problems/features to be solved/implemented for the various operating systems.

<hr>

### Windows

- [ ] The installer doesn't remove previously installed instances of the app
- [ ] There is a command-line window opening and closing quickly at the end of the _Windows_ setup wizard since no other _WixToolset_ feature for running commands quietly worked as expected.
- [ ] The sample graphics used for the _Windows_ installer should be modified. Since transparency is supported, I suggest the dialog background be limited to the left side only to follow the standards and fix the visual issues there. The same can apply to the banner image, traditionally only an icon was shown on the right side of it.
- [ ] Sign the package

<hr>

### macOS

- [x] ~~Possibility to run cargo bundle without building again~~ (solved by manually building the .app file)
- [ ] The wrapper script to open the app on macOS should be changed (#197)
- [ ] Add Homebrew cask as per #309
- [ ] Sign the package

<hr>

### Linux

- [ ] AppImage, Flatpak, and other kinds of packages
- [ ] Build and publish a Debian Source Package
comments: Feel free to list other problems/features that come to your mind and I'll add them @4r7if3x
Could be worth getting an SSL certificate to sign the Windows package. Otherwise Windows Defender gets upset that it is an unknown publisher.

> Could be worth getting an SSL certificate to sign the Windows package. Otherwise Windows Defender gets upset that it is an unknown publisher.

Yep, absolutely. I immediately add it to the set of features.
And similarly should also be done for macOS...

@GyulyVGC You'd need a registered company and enlist it with D&B to obtain a _Code Signing Certificate_. Besides, you can buy them cheaper from resellers such as [GoGetSSL](https://www.gogetssl.com/code-signing-ssl/).
Dang, I was hoping for a for a free solution but it may be utopian.
This may be an option for you: https://github.com/axodotdev/cargo-dist

> Dang, I was hoping for a for a free solution but it may be utopian.

Hi Giuliano (@GyulyVGC),

Perhaps you can check out [SignPath for Open Source projects](https://about.signpath.io/product/open-source)?

Kind Regards,
Liam
Thanks, will check!

I've been looking at packaging for Flatpak and AppImage for the last couple days.

While I can get it compiling into an installable and launchable Flatpak, I end up with the issue that it can't be granted the capabilities required. I looked at Wireshark's Flatpak to see if they worked around that, but it turns out they just patch it to say it can't be used to capture. 

AppImage has the same problem, I tried writing a wrapper script that grants the capabilities when the AppImage is run, but elevated commands (tried both sudo and pkexec to elevate) don't seem to have read or write access to the mount point in /tmp/ the AppImage files are in. It does however work if you elevate the entire AppImage.

issueDTO.title: Cray + NVIDIA GPU on NCSA Delta
issueDTO.description:
This is an example of how to use Cray compilers (17.0) on NCSA Delta with A100 devices for a minimal OpenACC program `test.f90`. It still needs to be integrated with MFC and ensured it works.

```shell
module load nvhpc
module load PrgEnv-cray
```

```shell
export CUDA_HOME=/sw/spack/deltas11-2023-03/apps/linux-rhel8-x86_64/gcc-8.5.0/cuda-12.3.0-7oylpzc
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=${CUDA_HOME}/lib64:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}
```

`ftn -haccel=nvidia80 -hacc -craype-verbose -M 296,878,1391,1069,5025 -h dynamic -h acc_model=auto_async_none -h acc_model=no_fast_addr -o test test.f90 -L/usr/lib64 -lcudart -L${CUDA_HOME}/lib64`
comments: Will look into this tonight

I have partitions on Delta for A40, A100, H200. I am not yet sure what is the end goal. I would appreciate more info on this issue.
Do you wanna make these commands part of standard `./mfc.sh load d`??

Something like these changes: https://github.com/Malmahrouqi3/MFC-mo2/commit/2573c904d47fdcc873ff06d9480d73eafac943c9

Kinda odd warning while building mfc
```bash
CMake Warning at CMakeLists.txt:482 (find_package):
  By not providing "FindcuTENSOR.cmake" in CMAKE_MODULE_PATH this project has
  asked CMake to find a package configuration file provided by "cuTENSOR",
  but CMake did not find one.

  Could not find a package configuration file provided by "cuTENSOR" with any
  of the following names:

    cuTENSORConfig.cmake
    cutensor-config.cmake

  Add the installation prefix of "cuTENSOR" to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH or set
  "cuTENSOR_DIR" to a directory containing one of the above files.  If
  "cuTENSOR" provides a separate development package or SDK, be sure it has
  been installed.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:562 (MFC_SETUP_TARGET)


CMake Warning at CMakeLists.txt:484 (message):
  Failed to locate the NVIDIA cuTENSOR library.  MFC will be built without
  support for it, disallowing the use of cu_tensor=T.  This can result in
  degraded performance.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:562 (MFC_SETUP_TARGET)
```

I found a better way to do this but it's more complicated. I need to put the description of how to do it in this GH issue. The above way isn't really reasonable, it would need many changes to the cmake file and it isn't worth it. I have a workaround that does the trick without many changes. Has to be on DeltaAI though.

But, at the moment on DeltaAI we cannot have runners. So, we might make it an option (so that users can do it) by modifying the necessary templates and such.

The goal of the issue is to make it so people can use cray compilers to offload to NVIDIA GPU devices and ensure their code works. Many folks don't have access to Frontier for Cray compilers with AMD GPU offloading, but DeltaAI is broadly available and had Cray compilers + NV GPUs which is a helpful debugging point.

issueDTO.title: Add GPU profiling to CI
issueDTO.description: Add GPU profiling on Phoenix to CI with nsight sys.
comments: Likely has to be done by someone at Gatech and so access to Phoenix for debugging purposes.
More detail: Should run MFC profiling on a GPU node and write the command line results to CI. Should probably compare results to known results from master (like the benchmark workflow does).

Simple poc to generate non-gpu nsys report in the CI https://github.com/Malmahrouqi3/MFC-mo2/actions/runs/15799705418/job/44536371819
To process the results for single/multiple report(s), Nsight Systems UI would do it. I do not know about how to do diff, but surely there has to be a way via nsys cli.

No sure yet how it is gonna behave with Phoenix, but integrating this into self-hosted `test.yml` is the way.
Also, never tested it, but I guess it is possible to profile a run locally using the workflow file with github cli `gh act -P ubuntu-latest=-self-hosted -W .github/workflows/profiling.yml` or by simply installing Nsights then `nsys profile -o report ./mfc.sh test -a --gpu`

@Malmahrouqi3 thanks, yes you can add it that way, it's a good POC. you actually just pass different commands to the nsys command, `nsys --help` or whatever, and it will give you the information on the command line and you would just dump that into the output of the CI. I'm not sure if a diff is the best way to go or not (presumably that would go into benchmarking since it would have to be PR vs. Master). 

The easiest way to get a merge in, that could possibly be migrated to benchmarking later, would be to just run the nsys command with appropriate flags, and it will tell you what the most expensive subroutines are. We have some documentation on nsight profiling in the MFC docs `./mfc.sh run <...> --profile` should work I think. But I think that will just create a report file you look at in the GUI.
`NVHPC_ACC_TIME` or `NVCOMPILER_ACC_TIME` may be an easy workaround for this. Should just work at runtime.

Can create an object path with a trailing slash.

## Actual

```sh
❯ lakectl -c fs upload lakefs://ev-test/main/dir-with-marker/  -s /dev/null
target path is not a valid URI
Error executing command.
```

## Impact

If I _need_ a directory marker empty object, I cannot use it.

### Workaround

`aws s3api put-object` (the Boto CLI) does not enforce incorrect ideas about URIs, and works.

issueDTO.description:
## Guideline
1. Carefully read the issue description before applying to ensure you have all the necessary information to start working on it.
2. Write a brief description of how you will approach the task (without using ChatGPT).
3. Add your Telegram handler in your application (e.g., in OnlyDust or similar)
4. Write ETA in your application



## What should I do if I have a problem
1. Try to google it before asking. Googling is taking major part of dev work 
2. If you couldn't find answer your question with Google, text your question to [dev](https://t.me/spotnet_dev/4) group with your question.
3. Do not send DM to maintainer, it would be better and faster to ask other contributors in chat 


## How to prepare PR
1. Check if your code [smell](https://refactoring.guru/refactoring/smells) good
2. Add `close #<issue number>` to link your issue with your PR
3. Do not commit changes that are unrelated to your task
4. Check after you created PR, if you committed everything


## Task Description
1. In the [handlers folder](./blob/main/margin/margin_app/app/telegram/handlers), create a new file named `admin.py`. Inside, add a handler called `/assets`. Use the [`Admin Filter` from this issue](https://github.com/djeck1432/spotnet/issues/915) to verify the user is an admin. Then, call the [`Assets statistic` method from this issue](https://github.com/djeck1432/spotnet/issues/906) to retrieve the data. Format the response using Telegram Markdown so it displays neatly.
2. Provide a screenshot demonstrating that the handler works as expected.

repository.description: Spot Leveraging in the Starknet Ecosystem
repository.name: spotnet

summary.main: Create assets statistic handler in the handlers folder, verifying the user is an admin and retrieving data using the Assets statistic method, and provide a screenshot demonstrating the handler's functionality.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The handler should be created in the handlers folder, verify the user is an admin using the Admin Filter, and retrieve data using the Assets statistic method. The response should be formatted using Telegram Markdown.
summary.attemptedFixes: None mentioned in the issue description
summary.otherNotes: The issue description provides guidelines for contributors, including how to approach the task, what to do if they encounter a problem, and how to prepare a PR. The task involves creating a new handler in the handlers folder, verifying the user is an admin using the Admin Filter, and retrieving data using the Assets statistic method.

Command:

lakectl branch delete lakefs://<bucket>/main -y

Current error message:

http://<uri>/api/v1/repositories/<bucket>/branches/main giving up after 5 attempt(s)
Error executing command.

Possible alternative:

Error executing command: you are trying to delete the default branch, which is not supported.

All the best!

issueDTO.title: UI - Graph option selector DagRun and Versions
issueDTO.description:
### Body

When we select a DagRun, automatically the Version will be changed to match the one of the dagrun and display the relevant structure of the dagrun, that's great.

When we do the opposite, for instance we select different versions for a specific dagrun it will display the version structure and try to match the execution of the DagRun on it. It makes sense for DagRun with multiple versions, but I don't think we should be able to explore DagVersions that are not part of the selected dagrun at all. 

It makes it hard to follow when we start playing with the `version selector` when a DagRun is selected. (Is the DagVersion that I have selected part of the DagRun.dag_versions, or am I watching a completely unrelated structure)


For instance in the following image I have the `v2` structure displayed for a DagRun that actually only has `v4` part of his versions. The output graph doesn't make much sense.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fb45d6a5-514f-464e-b756-39c8b0a70c39)


I do not know yet what is the best way to address this, any idea is welcome.
### Committer

- [x] I acknowledge that I am a maintainer/committer of the Apache Airflow project.
comments: cc: @bbovenzi I'd like your opinion on this
Hey! Can I work on this?
Makes sense to me!

issueDTO.title: Bug - Impossible to load UI if user does not have read permissions on plugins
issueDTO.description:
### Body

Plugins are loaded at the start of the web application to be able to fill extra menu items in the navbar.

Authenticated users but without `read` permissions on plugins will get a `403` forbidden error on that endpoint. That error is handled in a way that prevent the rest of the application to render and show a `Forbidden` page.

~~We should instead fail gracefully and continue rendering the UI even if extra plugins menu items cannot be fetched because the user does not have access. This way user can still use the default UI.~~

We want all user to be able to see extra menu items coming from the plugins. We should add an entry in the [ui/config](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/airflow-core/src/airflow/api_fastapi/core_api/routes/ui/config.py#L49) enpoints with `plugins_extra_menu_items` there (iterate over plugins `appbuilder_menu_items`), so all authenticated users can see them. Plug the UI on this new config attribute, not calling the `public/providers` endpoint anymore.

### Committer

- [x] I acknowledge that I am a maintainer/committer of the Apache Airflow project.
comments:
I can take this issue
Great, @tanujdargan you are assigned, I have updated the issue with another approach that might be better and easier. Let me know if that make sense.

repository.description: Apache Airflow - A platform to programmatically author, schedule, and monitor workflows
repository.name: airflow

summary.main: The main objective of the issue is to fix the bug where the UI cannot be loaded if the user does not have read permissions on plugins, and to make all authenticated users see the extra menu items from plugins.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires the UI to be rendered even if the user does not have access to the extra plugins menu items, and the user should still be able to see the default UI.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author has suggested to add an entry in the [ui/config](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/airflow-core/src/airflow/api_fastapi/core_api/routes/ui/config.py#L49) endpoints with `plugins_extra_menu_items` to make all authenticated users see the extra menu items.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about handling 403 forbidden error when user does not have read permissions on plugins, and instead of showing a Forbidden page, the UI should be rendered and extra plugins menu items should be fetched from [ui/config](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/airflow-core/src/airflow/api_fastapi/core_api/routes/ui/config.py#L49) endpoints.

### Task List

I have the following `jreleaser.toml`:

```

issueDTO.title: `run --recursive` and `run --filter` do not "fail" when no packages have the script
issueDTO.description:
<!--
  If this issue affects many people in a company/big team, create a post for your company in the following discussion:
  https://github.com/pnpm/pnpm/discussions/3787
  and link the issue in your post.

  This will help us prioritize issues that affect more people.
-->

### pnpm version: `8.5.1`

### Code to reproduce the issue:

In a multi-package workspace where "does_not_exist" is a script in no packages.

```shell
$ pnpm -r run does_not_exist && echo "hi"
Scope: 19 of 20 workspace projects
None of the selected packages has a "does_not_exist" script
ha
```

### Expected behavior:

echo should never be executed

```shell
$ pnpm -r run does_not_exist && echo "hi"
Scope: 19 of 20 workspace projects
None of the selected packages has a "does_not_exist" script
```

### Actual behavior:

echo is executed, run does not fail.

From the [docs](https://pnpm.io/cli/run#--recursive--r):  **If none of the packages have the command, the command fails.**

```shell
$ pnpm -r run does_not_exist && echo "hi"
Scope: 19 of 20 workspace projects
None of the selected packages has a "does_not_exist" script
 ha
```

and an example in github actions: https://github.com/functionless/eventual/actions/runs/5616119079/job/15217864354?pr=395#step:5:2

### Additional information:

 - `node -v` prints: v18.14.2
 - Windows, macOS, or Linux?: linux (WSL & github actions)
comments:
Actually, this was done like this by design. See related issue: https://github.com/pnpm/pnpm/issues/1763
and related PR: https://github.com/pnpm/pnpm/pull/2090

Maybe it would be better to revert those changes as they could just use the `--if-present` CLI flag (cc @bdchauvette)
There is also a --no-bail option as well. It is impossible to make it work like the docs specify unless you parse the output text. --no-bail and --if-present cannot be reversed.
Then we should correct the documentation.
same issue with `pnpm@7.33.5`

@kwaszczuk I had the same idea and filed this issue https://github.com/pnpm/pnpm/issues/9710 this should be relatively simple to implement afaict. I opened a dummy PR in the place where it seems like this should happen.
Oddly enough I cannot find anywhere in the codebase where that flag is currently used outside of a test..

repository.description: Fast, disk space efficient package manager
repository.name: pnpm

summary.main: The `run` command with `--recursive` and `--filter` flags does not fail when no packages have the specified script, which is contrary to the documentation.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue is related to the documentation, specifically the `--recursive` and `--filter` flags, which do not fail when no packages have the specified script.
summary.attemptedFixes: A feature to add a `--fail-if-no-script` option was proposed, and a dummy PR was opened.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to issue #1763 and PR #2090, and a similar issue was found in pnpm@7.33.5. The documentation should be corrected.

issueDTO.title: Add example for using `EsploraClient` with timeout configuration
issueDTO.description:
## Feature Request

An example showing how to configure and use `EsploraClient` with custom timeout settings would be helpful for developers using BDK with unreliable or slow network connections.

### Why?

Currently, the documentation does not illustrate how to:
- Set custom request timeouts when using `EsploraClient`
- Handle timeout-related errors gracefully

### What’s Expected?

Please add a simple example (in the `examples/` directory) demonstrating:
- Instantiating `EsploraClient` with a custom `ureq::Agent`
- Setting timeout durations (connect/read/write)
- Making a sample call (e.g., `get_height` or `get_tx`) with the client

### Example Reference

The relevant code might look like:

```rust
let agent = ureq::AgentBuilder::new()
    .timeout_connect(Duration::from_secs(10))
    .timeout_read(Duration::from_secs(30))
    .timeout_write(Duration::from_secs(30))
    .build();

let esplora_client = EsploraClient::from_agent("https://blockstream.info/api", agent);

repository.description: A modern, lightweight, descriptor-based wallet library written in Rust!
repository.name: bdk_wallet

summary.main: Add an example in the examples directory showing how to configure and use EsploraClient with custom timeout settings for developers with unreliable or slow network connections.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The example should demonstrate instantiating EsploraClient with a custom ureq::Agent, setting timeout durations, and making a sample call.
summary.attemptedFixes: None mentioned in the issue description.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to documentation and is marked as a good first issue.

issueDTO.description:
- 累積回報人次

issueDTO.title: Support optional object type attributes in Nomad HCL variables
issueDTO.description:
### Proposal

Support `optional(...)` in object type attributes, similar to the [equivalent feature from Terraform](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/expressions/type-constraints#optional-object-type-attributes)

### Use-cases

Variables that use complex types (e.g. `list(object({ ... }))`, where some fields are optional, currently have to be specified in full, or have to be defined as maps where the burden of type validation falls on the template author.

### Attempted Solutions

* Using a `type = map(string)` and checking each field for existence/type-correctness
* Using a `type = string`, setting the value to some structured data format, like JSON or YAML, which is then `(yaml|json)decode`d and its contents' fields checked for existence/type-correctness
comments: Hi @atavakoliyext and thanks for raising this issue. I think supporting the `type` definition within job specification variables in a similar manner to Terraform makes sense. I'll move this onto our roadmapping list.
Great to hear, thank you! I look forward to seeing where it lands on your roadmap 🙂
This seems like a good improvement, always thought this was actually supported. @jrasell I would love to take a crack at it.

I have been digging a bit. Seems like using `typeexpr.TypeConstraintWithDefaults` instead of `typeexpr.Type` https://github.com/hashicorp/nomad/blob/493e7b2faadc56cbd2057b84d0576ca74c4832aa/jobspec2/types.variables.go#L291-L298 from the `github.com/hashicorp/hcl/v2/ext/typeexpr` lib in  should add the optional (with default value support) for the variables.
Checking further to see if this has any unintended downstream effect.

repository.description: Nomad is an easy-to-use, flexible, and performant workload orchestrator that can deploy a mix of microservice, batch, containerized, and non-containerized applications. Nomad is easy to operate and scale and has native Consul and Vault integrations.
repository.name: nomad

summary.main: The main objective of the issue is to support optional object type attributes in Nomad HCL variables, similar to the feature in Terraform, to make it easier to define variables with complex types and optional fields.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The feature should be similar to the one in Terraform, supporting `optional(...)` in object type attributes. The variables should be able to use complex types (e.g. `list(object({ ... }))`, where some fields are optional, without having to specify them in full or define them as maps.
summary.attemptedFixes: Two attempted solutions were proposed: 1) using a `type = map(string)` and checking each field for existence/type-correctness, and 2) using a `type = string`, setting the value to some structured data format, like JSON or YAML, which is then decoded and its contents' fields checked for existence/type-correctness. Additionally, a contributor has suggested using `typeexpr.TypeConstraintWithDefaults`.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to adding support for optional object type attributes in Nomad HCL variables, similar to the feature in Terraform. The author has provided two attempted solutions, and another contributor has suggested using `typeexpr.TypeConstraintWithDefaults` from the `github.com/hashicorp/hcl/v2/ext/typeexpr` library.

issueDTO.title: Fork, Commit, Merge - Medium Issue 2 (React.js)
issueDTO.description:
# Fork, Commit, Merge - Medium Issue 2 (React.js)

## Create a Traffic Light Component
*Note: You don't have ask permission to start solving the issue or get assigned, since these issues are supposed to be always open for new contributors. The actions-user bot will reset the file back to previous state for the next contributor after your commit is merged. So you can just simply start working with the issue right away!*

### How to get started:

Start by navigating inside of the directory used in this project with the command:
```bash
cd tasks/react/medium/traffic-light
```

Then run `npm i` to install Vite, React and all the necessary dependencies for the project.

After installing the dependencies you can open the `src` directory and the `TrafficLight.tsx` file, and start implementing your solution!

![react-medium](https://github.com/fork-commit-merge/fork-commit-merge/assets/82566656/e154750d-41fd-4db4-bcc6-9dd52c7e55d6)

### Description:

Create a React component using TypeScript that simulates a traffic light. The component should display three lights (red, yellow, and green) and switch between them automatically in the order of a typical traffic light sequence.

### Requirements:

-   Implement a `TrafficLight` component in `src/TrafficLight.tsx`.
-   Use TypeScript for type safety.
-   The component should render three circles, colored red, yellow, and green.
-   The traffic light should start with the red light.
-   After a few seconds, it should change to green, then yellow, and then back to red in a continuous loop.
-   Only one light should be "active" (brighter) at a time.

There are some CSS classes already added for you in the `src/App.css` file, which you can use if you like, or write your own custom CSS.
There is for example a helper pseudo-class selector for every light that is not active, which will set the light color to gray if the light does not have the `active` class:

![react-medium-css](https://github.com/fork-commit-merge/fork-commit-merge/assets/82566656/052aaf61-e4d9-40b9-8876-bf96aa2ada9c)

### Example:

The traffic light should cycle as follows:

-   Red (active) for 4 seconds.
-   Green (active) for 3 seconds.
-   Yellow (active) for 1 second.
-   Repeat the cycle.

## How to run:
After you are done with the card, make sure you are in the `tasks/react/medium/traffic-light` in your terminal and run `npm run dev` to start the Vite server. Then, open "http://localhost:5173/" in your browser to check how the app looks.

If it looks to be working fine, you are ready to make a pull request!

---

To work with this issue, you need to have npm and NodeJS installed to your local machine.
Check out [README.md](https://github.com/nikohoffren/fork-commit-merge/blob/main/README.md) for more instructions of installing npm and NodeJS as well as how to make a pull request.

---

## Why use Vite?

This React project uses Vite for near-instant server start-ups and incredibly fast hot module replacements, providing a smooth and efficient development experience.
Also Vite requires minimal setup, allowing us to focus on writing React code without getting bogged down in complex configurations.
If you want to learn more about Vite, check out the documentation:
[Vite Official Documentation](https://vitejs.dev/)

---

Feel free to ask any questions here if you have some problems!

#### Also, kindly give this project a star to enhance its visibility for new developers!
comments: Hey mate! I will be working on this issue! And will let u know once finished!

issueDTO.title: Optimise performance of var-args functions by adding loop-unrolled variants
issueDTO.description:
### Is your feature request related to a problem?

There are a variety of `MultiArgFunction` functions, with variable argument lists. Often, these lists will be short (<5 arguments), but there is no guarantee that the JVM will unroll their loops automatically.

Functions that perform relatively simple operations may benefit from manually unrolled variants that skip loop and conditional checks, and instead have a straight bytecode path for the calculations.



### Describe the solution you'd like.

Review var-args functions, particularly those with numeric arguments and basic calculations. If they are a candidate for loop unrolling, implement and benchmark to prove it is faster.

Examples of var-args functions:

- greatest/least
- IN
- CASE
- coalesce
- ~l2price~
- concat

### Describe alternatives you've considered.

_No response_

### Full Name:

Nick Woolmer

### Affiliation:

QuestDB

### Additional context

_No response_
comments:
Hi, I would like to contribrute to solving this issue, it seems like you would like to take functions with multiple arguments and create standard versions where we would know the number of arguments beforehand and we can save time by not looping on the variables. I believe I can help with this issue with at least these function:

greatest/least
IN
CASE
l2price
concat

Is this issue still open? If so can you assign it to me? I'll try solving it. I am trying to start adding to open-source contribrutions so I think this would be a great beginner experience. Is there a specific timeframe you want this issue to be finished by?
For sure, go for it. `l2price` already has unrolled variants, so you can use that as a reference of what can be achieved for the other functions.
@nwoolmer , Could you please assign this task to me if it hasn’t been picked up yet? Thank you!

issueDTO.title: Create CONTRIBUTORS.md to acknowledge all project contributors
issueDTO.description:
## Description
We need to create a CONTRIBUTORS.md file to properly acknowledge and give credit to all the people who have contributed to the ruv-FANN project.

## Motivation
- Recognize the valuable contributions from the community
- Provide transparency about who has helped build this project
- Encourage future contributions by showing appreciation

## Implementation Plan
1. **Gather Contributors**
   - Review all GitHub issues and pull requests
   - Start with @ruvnet as the project creator
   - Include all contributors who have:
     - Submitted merged PRs
     - Reported issues that led to improvements
     - Provided valuable feedback or ideas
     - Contributed to documentation

2. **CONTRIBUTORS.md Format**
   ```markdown
   # Contributors

   Thank you to all the contributors who have helped make ruv-FANN better!

   ## Project Creator
   - **[ruvnet](https://github.com/ruvnet)** - Project creator and maintainer

   ## Code Contributors
   - [Contributor Name](https://github.com/username) - Brief description of contributions

   ## Issue Contributors
   - [Contributor Name](https://github.com/username) - Reported issues #X, #Y

   ## Documentation Contributors
   - [Contributor Name](https://github.com/username) - Improved documentation
   ```

3. **Process for Future Contributors**
   - Update CONTRIBUTORS.md when merging significant PRs
   - Include a note in PR template about contributor recognition
   - Consider automating with GitHub Actions in the future

## Tasks
- [ ] Create initial CONTRIBUTORS.md file
- [ ] Review all issues and PRs to identify contributors
- [ ] Add contributors with appropriate categories
- [ ] Submit PR with the new file
- [ ] Update contributing guidelines to mention contributor recognition

cc @ruvnet - This issue tracks the creation of a contributors file to acknowledge everyone who has helped with the project.

summary.main: The objective of the issue is to add a blob() method to DotNetStreamReference in Blazor, which allows developers to obtain a Blob from a .NET stream in JavaScript, without fully loading the stream into memory. This simplifies developer workflows by aligning with common web APIs that expect a Blob.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The requirement is to add a blob() method to DotNetStreamReference in Blazor, which returns a Blob representing the .NET stream. The Blob should be used with standard web APIs (e.g., <video>, <audio>, URL.createObjectURL()). The method should keep performance and memory usage efficient for large streams.
summary.attemptedFixes: A PR has been created for this design proposal: #62298. The PR includes the implementation and relevant tests. The team is open to adjusting the PR if anything needs to be changed or improved.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about adding a blob() method to DotNetStreamReference in Blazor to obtain a Blob from a .NET stream in JavaScript, without fully loading the stream into memory. The issue is a 'good-first-issue' and is part of a competition. The main goal is to simplify developer workflows by aligning with common web APIs that expect a Blob. The implementation complexity is a risk, as creating a Blob from a .NET stream across JS interop might require platform-level work to ensure true streaming behavior rather than just buffering and converting.

issueDTO.title: Config flashes before "Loading" screen on subdomains
issueDTO.description:
When opening page on a subdomain for the first time, config flashes at the bottom of the page:

> [screen-recorder-fri-dec-13-2024-17-29-57.webm](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/899f9c22-5489-4ba6-ae0a-0687f7d89c9a)


This likely occurs when default index.html loads in iframe to read config. 
We should hide entire DOM if URL is landing page (no path, no subdomain).
comments: Can you assign me this issue, I would love to resolve this.
@Winter-Soren please feel free to work on this and open a PR :)

This seems to be happening again on inbrowser.link and .dev.

Let's take an opportunity to  improve the UI.

Good idea from @autonome:

> would be super cool if that interstitial had all website ui removed, just be a loading animation in the middle, with a very short msg communicating the value of the wait

related ideas:
- reuse fullscreen animation from the header of  [helia.io](https://helia.io/)?  
- reuse heartbeat css from ipfs-companion?
- have text that says "initializing Service Worker... TIP: visit `inbrowser.link` to adjust settings" ?

@lidel We *have* to show the iframe or it wont load config from global domain. do we still want that functionality?

config iframe started showing again in https://github.com/ipfs/service-worker-gateway/pull/677

One thing we can do with config loading from root that I forgot about until just now was the get config JSON call to the SW.. instead of loading the UI (dealing with defaults, async loading issues, and UI delays, etc.) the iframe config should simply query the SW-config `await fetch('?ipfs-sw-config-get=true')` and post that to the subdomain page (the parent of the iframe)..

Can we return an HTML page that simply handles "postMessage" directly from the service worker...? e.g.

```
<iframe src=`${parentDomain}?ipfs-sw-config-get-for-subdomain=true` />
```

> We have to show the iframe or it wont load config from global domain

This seems to fail sporadically. For example, when loading `/ipns/vitalik.eth` (I made sure the origin's local data was cleared before), it seems like there's a race condition and it doesn't have enough time for the config to load from the main origin (see the `enableRecursiveGateways` config).

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/20d20eae-92ca-450f-af7e-746340d10b63)

> the iframe config should simply query the SW-config await fetch('?ipfs-sw-config-get=true') and post that to the subdomain page (the parent of the iframe)

This sounds like a good idea both from a UX perspective as it would reduce the rendering overhead incurred by loading the config UI. 

However, if we cannot get config to reliably load from the root domain (`inbrowser.link`), I think global config is more misleading than helpful.

This probably needs to be revisited after #757 is addressed.

Have static HTML+CSS that by default shows loading screen, so if it flashes during those redirects, then it is a meaningful loading message, and not a janky UI flash.

Anecdotally, https://bafkreibm6jg3ux5qumhcn2b3flc3tyu6dmlb4xa7u5bf44yegnrjhc4yeq.ipfs.inbrowser.link/  on cold load requires fetching 2.4MiB and takes 2.86 seconds on my 500Mbit fiber and ~12s on 3G

this should be fixed with the latest deployment of v1.13.4 to inbrowser.dev: https://github.com/ipfs/service-worker-gateway/actions/runs/15902783209

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e916380a-d90e-4940-b436-008ab3fe1d35

Nice, way better experience than seeing a full-frame of content!

Is there a way to remove the first icon flash?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/067182d0-3f16-4984-a08f-d2a8e8d916a5)

@autonome it's currently hardcoded in the HTML, so it shows 3 times currently with v1.13.4: 
1. on first hit to subdomain (html,css,js downloaded, browser renders content, runs js, redirects to root)
2. on hit to root domain (same scenario as above, except you may have css/html/js cached in your browser, and redirects to subdomain with config values)
3. on final landing on subdomain, assets are cached, and the content of the page is displayed while SW is registered, and `window.location.replace` is called that is intercepted by the SW

So I am thinking I can delay showing the loading icon entirely until that last item above.

Happy to go with what users are thinking will work best.. or any clever solutions to render something more pleasing to the eye. I'll be trying to get some live feedback from @2color and @lidel on this sometime this week too.

> [@autonome](https://github.com/autonome) it's currently hardcoded in the HTML, so it shows 3 times currently with v1.13.4:
> 
> So I am thinking I can delay showing the loading icon entirely until that last item above.

+1

doing any work before the first redirect in the worst case scenario (nothing cached) guarantees a worse visual experience, since another redirect (visual flash) is guaranteed.

pushing all work to after 2nd redirect _might_ be better, but would need some testing to understand whether it could cause too long of a delay with no visual indicator at all.

>  redirects to subdomain with config values

(sorry i'm out of the loop on this work, feel free to link me to something to rtfm)

what are these values and why can't they shipped out to the client w/o the double redirect?

> > redirects to subdomain with config values > > (sorry i'm out of the loop on this work, feel free to link me to something to rtfm) > > what are these values and why can't they shipped out to the client w/o the double redirect? The config values determine some of the parameters for Verified Fetch and how retrieval works: We currently redirect so that users can change the configuration for subdomain origins, e.g. `cid.ipfs.inbrowser.link`. The reason we do this is because it's not clear from a UX perspective how to best allow users to change configuration for subdomains without modifying the verified response. The "insider way to do this is to append `/#/ipfs-sw-config` to the subdomain URI which will load the config page. @SgtPooki and I discussed some ideas on how to solve this: - Add a query parameter to disable the config redirect - Removing the config redirect by default (also a minor perf win) - Using the IPFS Companion extension to detect the SW and either allowing config from there or a button linking you to the config hash fragment

for now I think the config redirect is a pretty good improvement while not adding much latency. It is also extremely useful for testing, tbh, but also some potential future privacy/security concerns. We can disable or adjust easily in the future once we get the config in companion or get more feedback that folks really don't care about the shared config at all.

issueDTO.title: Support parsing MySQL stored procedure syntax - part 0
issueDTO.description:
# Background
Hi community,

ShardingSphere's parser engine enables users to parse SQL into AST (Abstract Syntax Tree) and convert it into SQLStatement objects. 
This issue focuses on enhancing MySQL stored procedure parsing capabilities to support complex database programming logic.

More details:
https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/en/reference/sharding/parse/

# Issue Background Explanation

These SQL statements are from the official MySQL test set. 
You can find the corresponding stored procedure SQL statements in the following website: https://github.com/mysql/mysql-server/tree/8.0/mysql-test/t 
These SQL cases are then passed to ShardingSphere's parsing engine for analysis. 
For SQL cases that fail to be parsed successfully, every 3 to 5 SQL cases are grouped together as an issue.
1. It cannot be guaranteed that all SQL cases are correct. Please follow the following process to handle this pull request (PR).
2. Some SQL cases may have already been fixed in other PRs. For cases that can already be executed successfully, simply leave a comment to ignore them.
3. If a SQL case can be executed successfully without any code changes, there is no need to add a corresponding test assert file.

# Task
This issue requires adding support for the following MySQL stored procedure syntax:
```sql
-- The original file and line number of the sql: analyze:85 
CREATE PROCEDURE p() ANALYZE TABLE v UPDATE HISTOGRAM ON w
```

```sql
-- The original file and line number of the sql: change_user_deadlock:35 
END |
CREATE PROCEDURE p_processlist()
BEGIN
DECLARE x INT DEFAULT 3000
```

```sql
-- The original file and line number of the sql: change_user_deadlock:26 
CREATE PROCEDURE p_flush_status()
BEGIN
DECLARE x INT DEFAULT 3000
```

```sql
-- The original file and line number of the sql: clear_diag_area:254 
CREATE PROCEDURE p7_show_warnings ()
BEGIN
SHOW VARIABLES LIKE 'foo';
SHOW WARNINGS;
SELECT "(SHOW WARNINGS does not have to come last)";
END
```

```sql
-- The original file and line number of the sql: clear_diag_area:263 
CREATE PROCEDURE p8b_show_warnings ()
BEGIN
SHOW WARNINGS;
END
```


# Overall Procedure
If you intend to participate in fixing this issue, please feel free to leave a comment below the issue. Community members will assign the issue accordingly.
For example, you can leave a comment like this: "Hi, please assign this issue to me. Thank you!"

Once you have claimed the issue, please review the syntax of the SQL on the official website of the corresponding database. 
Execute the SQL on the respective database to ensure the correctness of the SQL syntax.

You can check the corresponding source of each SQL case on the official database website.
Next, execute the problematic SQL cases mentioned above in the database (you can quickly start the corresponding database using the Docker image for that database, and then connect to it using a client you are  familiar with), to ensure that the SQL syntax itself is correct.


Once you have confirmed the correctness of the SQL syntax, you can validate and fix the grammar parsing issue in ShardingSphere.
>If you are using IntelliJ IDEA, you will need to install the ANTLR plugin before proceeding.
If it is an ANTLR parsing error message, try to repair the `.g4` file by comparing it with the official database syntax until the SQL can be correctly parsed by ANTLR.
When there is no error message in the ANTLR Preview window, it means that ANTLR can correctly parse the SQL.


After ANTLR parses SQL into an abstract syntax tree, ShardingSphere will access the abstract syntax tree through Visitor and extract the required information.
If you need to extract Segments, you need to first execute:
```shell
mvn -T 2C clean install -DskipTests
```
Under the shardingsphere-parser module to compile the entire parser module.
Then rewrite the corresponding visit method in SQLStatementVisitorr as needed to extract the corresponding Segment.


After the above SQL parsing problem is repaired, the corresponding Test needs to be added.
The steps are as follows:
1. Add the corresponding `sql-case` in the `sql/supported` directory.
2. Add case assertions in the case directory of the `shardingsphere-test-it-parser` module.
3. Run `org.apache.shardingsphere.test.it.sql.parser.internal.InternalSQLParserIT`
After SQL Parser IT runs successfully, you can submit a PR.


1. Master JAVA language
2. Have a basic understanding of Antlr g4 file
3. Be familiar with MySQL SQLs
comments: Hi, can you please assign this to me ?
@AmitAnveri Welcome, I just assign this issue to you.
Hi , is the slack channel active , I have asked for help on this issue on slack ?
@strongduanmu @AmitAnveri, Could you please assign this task to me if it hasn’t been picked up yet? Thank you!

The task requires adding support for specific MySQL stored procedure syntax. Community members will assign the issue accordingly. issueDTO.title: Fork, Commit, Merge - Easy Issue (Solid.js)
issueDTO.description:
# Fork, Commit, Merge - Easy Issue (Solid.js)

## Implement a Simple Counter in Solid.js

In this task, you will implement a simple counter using the Solid.js framework. This will help you learn the basics of reading and updating signals in Solid.js.

---
***Note: You don't have ask permission to start solving the issue or get assigned, since these issues are supposed to be always open for new contributors. The actions-user bot will reset the file back to previous state for the next contributor after your commit is merged. So you can just simply start working with the issue right away!***

Issue created by ***![zshaian](https://github.com/zshaian)***.

## Getting Started

You can start by navigating to the folder `./task/solid/easy`

Once you are on that folder you can then install the packages that you are going to need to run Solid.js framework, you can do so by running `npm i`

After installing the dependencies you can open the src directory and App.jsx file, and start implementing your solution!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/682663cd-4af6-4c69-b3f7-4e8e41bfb798)

**All the CSS classes needed in this project has already been done for you in index.css and app.module.css.**

## Requiremets:

- Implement the counter state with the name of "count" and a setter named "setCount"
- Display the current count
- Increment or Decrement the count state using the "setCount"

If you can display the current count and increment or decrement it based on the buttons, you are ready to make a pull request.

---
To work with this issue, you need to have npm and NodeJS installed to your local machine.
Check out [README.md](https://github.com/fork-commit-merge/fork-commit-merge/blob/main/README.md) for more instructions of installing npm and NodeJS as well as how to make a pull request.

Feel free to ask any questions here if you have some problems!

**Also, kindly give this project a star to enhance its visibility for new developers!**

Sure!
Done with the task! Please have a look! Thank you!

issueDTO.title: Option to "Add this element to collection elements" in "Open webpage in new tab" action
issueDTO.description: We need that a cell that open a website is added to collection elements. We think that the best is to add an option similar to Navigate to other grid action.
comments: should be solved in a generic way, see #514

So, we understand that it's not possible to collect the cell to the current sentence, isn't it? As yo comment on #504 "action like navigation or an external action like HTTP shouldn't be collected to the current sentence" and we don't say an option to force to add it to collect element. So, we understand is not possible.

Currently elements with some kinds of actions like HTTP or navigation to other grid etc. are not collected to collection element. For action `navigate to other grid` we have the option to override this behaviour (`add to collect element despite navigation`). I think this option should be available for all kinds of actions which prevent adding to collect element by default. The generic option should be named something like `force to add element to collect element` and maybe it should be in general -> advanced instead of at configuring the action?!

We already have this global setting:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/39f1ea33-7a48-4226-b726-054e827b1fd4)

So maybe this should be a dropdown with values: `automatic` (default), `don't add to collect element` and `add to collect element`

> Currently elements with some kinds of actions like HTTP or navigation to other grid etc. are not collected to collection element. For action `navigate to other grid` we have the option to override this behaviour (`add to collect element despite navigation`). I think this option should be available for all kinds of actions which prevent adding to collect element by default. The generic option should be named something like `force to add element to collect element` and maybe it should be in general -> advanced instead of at configuring the action?!

ok, understand. 

> So maybe this should be a dropdown with values: `automatic` (default), `don't add to collect element` and `add to collect element`

Yes, we think that it would be the best solution. 

Thanks

issueDTO.title: Type Scheme Ordering causes ast_transform_test to fail
issueDTO.description:
In some rare cases, the variable order for multiple variable in a type scheme is transformed differently.

```erlang
1) ast_transform_test:-all_file_test_/0-fun-0-/0: test_files/ast_transform/funspec.erl                  
     Failure/Error: ?assert(false)                                                                        
       expected: true                                                                                     
            got: false                                                                                    
     %% lists.erl:2641:in `lists:foreach_1/2`                                                             
     Output: Test in test_files/ast_transform/funspec.erl:0 failed: AST does not have the right form after
 transformation. Diff (--- expected, +++ given):                                                          
--- ./terms_1_123-1329437-29778DD.erl   2025-07-02 13:49:48.691268532 +0200                               
+++ ./terms_2_163-1329437-22EBB1F.erl   2025-07-02 13:49:48.691268532 +0200                               
@@ -1,7 +1,7 @@                                                                                           
 [{attribute,{loc,[],0,0},module,funcall},                                                                
  {attribute,{loc,[],0,0},                                                                                
             spec,foo,1,                                                                                  
-            {ty_scheme,[{'Y',{predef_alias,number}},{'_X',{predef,atom}}],                               
+            {ty_scheme,[{'_X',{predef,atom}},{'Y',{predef_alias,number}}],                               
                        {intersection,[{fun_full,[{tuple,[{var,'_X'},{predef,integer}]}],{var,'_X'}},{fun_
full,[{tuple,[{var,'_X'},{list,{var,'Y'}}]}],{var,'Y'}}]}},                                               
             without_mod},                                                                                
  {function,{loc,[],0,0},foo,1,[{fun_clause,{loc,[],0,0},[{wildcard,{loc,[],0,0}}],[],[{atom,{loc,[],0,0},
ok}]}]}]                                                                                                  
\ No newline at end of file                                                                               
                                                                                                          
     Output: Test in test_files/ast_transform/funspec.erl:0 failed: AST does not have the right form after
 transformation. Diff (--- expected, +++ given):                                                          
--- ./terms_1_123-1329437-29778DD.erl   2025-07-02 13:49:48.691268532 +0200
+++ ./terms_2_163-1329437-22EBB1F.erl   2025-07-02 13:49:48.691268532 +0200
@@ -1,7 +1,7 @@
 [{attribute,{loc,[],0,0},module,funcall},
  {attribute,{loc,[],0,0}, 
             spec,foo,1,
-            {ty_scheme,[{'Y',{predef_alias,number}},{'_X',{predef,atom}}],
+            {ty_scheme,[{'_X',{predef,atom}},{'Y',{predef_alias,number}}],
                        {intersection,[{fun_full,[{tuple,[{var,'_X'},{predef,integer}]}],{var,'_X'}},{fun_
full,[{tuple,[{var,'_X'},{list,{var,'Y'}}]}],{var,'Y'}}]}},
             without_mod}, 
  {function,{loc,[],0,0},foo,1,[{fun_clause,{loc,[],0,0},[{wildcard,{loc,[],0,0}}],[],[{atom,{loc,[],0,0},
ok}]}]}]
```

This is the module to be transformed:

```erlang
-module(funspec).
-spec foo({_X, integer()}) -> _X when _X :: atom()
         ; ({_X, [Y]}) -> Y when Y :: number().
foo(_) -> ok.
```

The test failure is caused by the non-deterministic order of type variables in the generated `ty_scheme` attribute during AST transformation.
* The test expects type variables in the order: [{'Y', ...}, {'_X', ...}]
* The actual transformation produces: [{'_X', ...}, {'Y', ...}]

Check where (or if) the variable order for Erlang is defined and if we are transforming it correctly. If it is undefined, maybe it is better to sort them to not get non-deterministic behavior.

repository.description: Static typechecker for Erlang
repository.name: etylizer

summary.main: Type Scheme Ordering causes ast_transform_test to fail
summary.validationOrRequirement: The test expects type variables in the order: [{'Y', ...}, {'_X', ...}]
summary.attemptedFixes: Check where (or if) the variable order for Erlang is defined and if we are transforming it correctly. If it is undefined, maybe it is better to sort them to not get non-deterministic behavior.
summary.otherNotes: The test failure is caused by the non-deterministic order of type variables in the generated ty_scheme attribute during AST transformation.
