issueDTO.title: bug:  `kflex` fails when `kflex-initial-ctx-name` is invalid
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the bug

`kflex create cp1` fails when the kubeconfig contains a  `kflex-initial-ctx-name` pointing to an invalid contexts

```shell
kflex create cp1
✔ Checking for saved initial context...
✔ Switching to initial context...
Error getting client: error building kubeconfig: invalid configuration: [context was not found for specified context: kind-kubeflex, cluster has no server defined]
```

### Steps To Reproduce

1. kflex init -c
2. kind delete clusters --all
3. oc login ....
4. helm upgrade --install kubeflex-operator chart/ --namespace kubeflex-system --set isOpenShift=true

the `kubeconfig` still contains something like:

```yaml
preferences:
  extensions:
  - extension:
      data:
        kflex-initial-ctx-name: kind-kubeflex
      metadata:
        creationTimestamp: null
        name: kflex-config-extension-name
    name: kflex-config-extension-name
```

Then 

```shell
kflex create cp1
✔ Checking for saved initial context...
✔ Switching to initial context...
Error getting client: error building kubeconfig: invalid configuration: [context was not found for specified context: kind-kubeflex, cluster has no server defined]
```

### Expected Behavior

`kflex` should check on the validity of `kflex-initial-ctx-name` before using it.
If it is not valid, ignore it, assume that it was not enetered before

### Additional Context

_No response_
comments:
I find that with KubeFlex 0.6.3, if the extension stores the name of a context that exists but is not working, this is an unrecoverable state: no `kflex ctx` command will fix it. For example, I set the extension to say the hosting context is "kscore-stage" at a time when that context exists but is unusable. Then:

```console
mspreitz@mjs13 kubestellar % kubectl config use-context kind-kubeflex
Switched to context "kind-kubeflex".

mspreitz@mjs13 kubestellar % kflex ctx wds1
kubeconfig context wds1 not found (context wds1 not found), trying to load from server...
◐ Switching to context wds1...Error getting kf client: error creating NewDiscoveryRESTMapper: Get "https://c115-e.us-south.containers.cloud.ibm.com:30486/api": dial tcp 50.22.129.34:30486: connect: connection refused

mspreitz@mjs13 kubestellar % kflex ctx
✔ Checking for saved hosting cluster context...
✔ Switching to hosting cluster context...

mspreitz@mjs13 kubestellar % kubectl config current-context
kscore-stage

mspreitz@mjs13 kubestellar % yq .preferences ${KUBECONFIG:-$HOME/.kube/config}
extensions:
  - extension:
      data:
        kflex-initial-ctx-name: kscore-stage
      metadata:
        creationTimestamp: null
        name: kflex-config-extension-name
    name: kflex-config-extension-name
```
Note also that https://docs.kubestellar.io/release-0.24.0/direct/get-started/ does not invoke `kflex init` or `kflex create`, it only has `kflex ctx` commands.

Hi @MikeSpreitzer ! I'm interested in working on this issue. Based on my understanding, the problem occurs when KubeFlex tries to use a stored context from the kubeconfig extensions that is either invalid or no longer exists.

I'm planning to implement a solution that would:
1. Validate the stored context before using it
2. Add proper fallback logic when an invalid context is detected
3. Provide clear user feedback about what's happening

Is this approach aligned with what you're looking for? Are there any additional considerations I should be aware of before I start working on a PR?

UPDATE:

Starting #386 - kubeflex changes its usage of kubeconfig extensions (see https://github.com/kubestellar/kubeflex/blob/main/docs/users.md#v090)

In kubeflex, extensions are easier to use thanks to our internal package https://github.com/kubestellar/kubeflex/tree/main/pkg/kubeconfig

As consequences, the key `kflex-initial-ctx-name` is outdated. Have a look to the new consts https://github.com/kubestellar/kubeflex/tree/main/pkg/kubeconfig/extensions.go 

CC: @francostellari @Rupam-It
@francostellari can i work on this

@blazethunderstorm go for it. 

However, be mindful of these changes specified on the following comment https://github.com/kubestellar/kubeflex/issues/202#issuecomment-2965651600
@rxinui alright would take care of that
@blazethunderstorm are you still working on this issue?
@Arpit529Srivastava yes would make its pr today only

issueDTO.title: How do I distinguish the role in Aurora-MySQL?
issueDTO.description:
I saw that the [code](https://github.com/qonto/prometheus-rds-exporter/blob/88950eb83a655301eb41ab39e186be94d415fed4/internal/app/rds/helper.go#L111 ) updates the role value to either primary or replica.
For engine: MySQL, this seems normal, but for engine: Aurora-MySQL, all instances are marked as primary (not reader or writer).
comments: Hey, this project was mainly built for RDS PostgreSQL and we don't guarantee Aurora support yet. Don't hesitate to contribute if you know what could help update the role value.

We are following interest for Aurora in #46. It's indeed de facto a bit confusing because Aurora instances are detected, but role is not accurate. The role values `primary/replica` for RDS and `writer/reader` for Aurora are also very different. Some users may have mix of RDS and Aurora clusters. Having same role names for RDS and Aurora will simplify dashboards and alerts, but are inaccurate regarding AWS terms. @ZacharyZhuoOpenNet in term of experience, are you expecting to have same role names for Aurora and RDS? @ZacharyZhuoOpenNet Please upvote on #46 as we may have an update on Aurora support this year

Hello,
I'm starting the development to add proper support of Aurora, I'll share my pull request in https://github.com/qonto/prometheus-rds-exporter/issues/46

summary.otherNotes: The role values for RDS and Aurora are different, with RDS having primary/replica and Aurora having writer/reader. Some users may have a mix of RDS and Aurora clusters. Having same role names for RDS and Aurora will simplify dashboards and alerts, but are inaccurate regarding AWS terms.

issueDTO.title: 'no_proxy' env var not evaluated
issueDTO.description:
### Steps To Reproduce

1.Set `http_proxy`, `https_proxy` and `no_proxy` env vars (including the bitwarden server in `no_proxy`).
2. Execute a Bitwarden CLI command (example: 'bw list items')

### Expected Result

The Bitwarden CLI should respect the `no_proxy` variable and don't use the proxy.

### Actual Result

The Bitwarden CLI will try to send a post request to the Bitwarden server using the proxy.

### Screenshots or Videos

_No response_

### Additional Context

This behavior was observed on Linux. I can't state if the behavior on other OSes is comparable.

### Operating System

Linux

### Operating System Version

Ubuntu 24.04.2 LTS

### Shell

Bash

### Build Version

2025.1.3

### Issue Tracking Info

- [x] I understand that work is tracked outside of Github. A PR will be linked to this issue should one be opened to address it, but Bitwarden doesn't use fields like "assigned", "milestone", or "project" to track progress.
comments:
Thank you for reporting this issue! We've added this to our internal tracking system.
ID: PM-19047

Hi @frq-asgard-josi and thank you for your report.

Bitwarden uses [https-proxy-agent](https://www.npmjs.com/package/https-proxy-agent) to handle proxied connections on the CLI. This is either an upstream issue or we might need to switch over to using [proxy-agent](https://www.npmjs.com/package/proxy-agent) from the same maintainer, which proxies 😂 calls based on the set env-variables.

Mid/Long-term, Bitwarden CLI will likely benefit moving over to using native NodeJS fetch support and proxy via [undici](https://github.com/nodejs/undici). I looked into this a while ago, but it hasn't been a priority to migrate.

Marking this as good first issue, in case anyone would like to start investigating.

Kind regards,
Daniel

repository.description: Bitwarden client apps (web, browser extension, desktop, and cli).
repository.name: clients

summary.main: The 'no_proxy' environment variable is not being respected by the Bitwarden CLI, and it is trying to send a post request to the Bitwarden server using the proxy.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The 'no_proxy' env var should be evaluated by the Bitwarden CLI, and it should not use the proxy for connections to the Bitwarden server.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author did some digging and found that the logic in proxy-from-env for interpreting 'NO_PROXY' may be the root cause. There is an open issue and a fix for it.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to Bitwarden CLI not respecting the 'no_proxy' environment variable, and it was observed on Linux. The Bitwarden CLI uses https-proxy-agent to handle proxied connections, and it might be an upstream issue or they need to switch to using proxy-agent. Mid-term, Bitwarden CLI will likely move to using native NodeJS fetch support and proxy via undici. The issue is marked as good first issue for anyone who wants to investigate.

issueDTO.title: Make it so that the display configuration auto reloads
issueDTO.description:
## Requirements
- When a user modifies the display configuration, we should automatically reload it. See the regular miracle config for inspiration!
- If the configuration has any issues, we should abandon the reload and make sure that we haven't applied any changes yet

## Future Requirement
- Publish any errors to the client (somehow!) so that they can view them on the screen (in a similar way to how i3 tells you when your config is incorrect). This same mechanism should be used for the regular miracle config too. This should be a separate task!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b98f7b16-f98e-460a-9a63-f5771bc79f8b)
This works fine, but what about the hermes stuff? Maybe this causes the problems?
Any updates on this? Does anyone else also have this issue?

Since I can’t reproduce the issue myself, I can’t think of any way to solve it… Even after looking at the code, the plugin seems to only handle Sentry uploads.

issueDTO.title: feat(tests): port ethereum/tests test cases (tracking issue)
issueDTO.description:
This is a top-level issue for tracking the manual porting of ethereum/tests test cases to execution-spec-tests:

> **Contributions to manually port individual test cases are very welcome!**

**If you're already familiar with ethereum/tests and execution-spec-tests, jump to the issue tracker below!**

#### Background
[ethereum/tests](https://github.com/ethereum/tests) was the repository used to define EVM test cases from [Frontier](https://ethereum.org/en/history/#frontier) up to and including [The Merge](https://ethereum.org/en/history/#paris). The test cases are defined as YAML (and sometimes JSON) files in the [./src/ sub-directory](https://github.com/ethereum/tests/tree/develop/src) and the JSON "test fixtures" (fully-populated tests that can be executed against clients) are generated using [ethereum/retesteth](https://github.com/ethereum/retesteth). These JSON artifacts are regenerated when required and added to the repository, for example, in the [./GeneralStateTests/ sub-directory](https://github.com/ethereum/tests/tree/develop/GeneralStateTests).

From [Shanghai](https://ethereum.org/en/history/#shapella) on, new test cases (in particular for new features included in hard-forks) have been defined in Python in this repository (execution-spec-tests). The existing test cases are still important to execute against clients, however, and porting ethereum/tests to execution-spec-tests ensures that the test cases can be continually maintained and filled (generated) for newer forks. It also has the advantage that client teams will only need to obtain test fixture releases from one source.

#### Automated Port to Python
Although there will be an effort to automate ("transpile") the remaining test cases from YAML (respectively JSON) to Python; contributions to manually port individual test cases can be very beneficial and are welcome! 

The benefits of manual porting are:
1. Reduce the number of test cases by combing multiple YAML (resp. JSON) test cases in one Python test function (via parametrization).
2. Potentially improve coverage by parametrizing the Python version.
3. Code/docstrings are likely higher quality than an automated conversion.
4. The test can be better [organized within the `./tests` folder](https://ethereum.github.io/execution-spec-tests/main/writing_tests/adding_a_new_test/) in execution-spec-tests by the fork and the EIP in which the functionality was introduced.

#### Process
1. Pick a single or a set of YAML test cases in ethereum/tests to port and create an issue in this repository - optional, but definitely recommended if porting tests from the tracker below to avoid duplicate work.
2. Create a PR with the ported tests:
    a. Add the list of ported YAML files to [converted-ethereum-tests.txt](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/blob/1b30c336eae6b0746ea4db441ac74406f2fb2322/converted-ethereum-tests.txt).
    b. If the tests can't currently be filled, please explain the issue (feel free to also [open a Discussion](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/discussions/new?category=general)).

#### Help with ethereum/tests

The test formats are described in the [ethereum/tests online docs](https://ethereum-tests.readthedocs.io/en/latest/blockchain-ref.html). Note that state filler test cases in YAML can be parametrized, see the [docs here](https://ethereum-tests.readthedocs.io/en/latest/test_filler/state_filler.html#the-indexes).

#### Hints to Get Started with ethereum/execution-spec-tests

0. Start here: [Getting Started → Installation](https://ethereum.github.io/execution-spec-tests/main/getting_started/installation/).
1. Use `uv run et make test` to create a template test module (currently a WIP in #950).
2. Where to put the test? See how tests are organized in [Writing Tests → Adding a New Test](https://ethereum.github.io/execution-spec-tests/main/writing_tests/adding_a_new_test/).
3. State vs Blockchain test? If in doubt try to write a state test, see [Writing Tests → Types of Tests → Deciding on a Test Type](https://ethereum.github.io/execution-spec-tests/main/writing_tests/types_of_tests/#deciding-on-a-test-type).
4. Tests are filled via EELS by default (no further installation necessary; it's a Python dependency and got installed in Step 0), see [Filling  → Getting Started](https://ethereum.github.io/execution-spec-tests/main/filling_tests/getting_started/).
5. Parametrizing test functions is encouraged, see [Writing Tests → Writing a New Test → Parametrizing Tests](https://ethereum.github.io/execution-spec-tests/main/writing_tests/writing_a_new_test/#parametrizing-tests).
6. The Opcode mini-lang defined in this repository is the preferred way to define bytecode in tests (if feasible). For a very simple example, see [`test_chainid()`](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/blob/85393456e75f5f3b476cb5e61c35d48172f9d543/tests/istanbul/eip1344_chainid/test_chainid.py#L28) - there are other examples in the tests.

Feel free to reach out for help or guidance in the Ethereum R&D discord or via DM; see [Getting Help](https://ethereum.github.io/execution-spec-tests/main/getting_started/getting_help/) in the docs.

repository.description: A Python framework and collection of test cases to generate test vectors for Ethereum execution clients
repository.name: execution-spec-tests

summary.main: Port Ethereum test cases from YAML/JSON to Python, contributing to the execution-spec-tests repository.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The requirements for porting test cases include creating a PR with the ported tests, adding the list of ported YAML files to a specific file, and ensuring that the tests are correctly filled and executed.
summary.attemptedFixes: Some contributors have already attempted to port specific test cases, but there are still many to be done. The issue tracker provides a list of test cases to be ported. Some contributors have also expressed skepticism about automated porting and prefer to focus on rewriting the tests.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is about porting Ethereum test cases from YAML/JSON to Python. It's a top-level issue for tracking the manual porting of test cases. Contributions to manually port individual test cases are welcome. The benefits of manual porting include reducing the number of test cases, improving coverage, and increasing code quality. The process involves picking a single or set of YAML test cases, creating a PR with the ported tests, and adding the list of ported YAML files to a specific file. There are some examples of ported tests provided.

issueDTO.title: Is it worth lowering the cost of `equalsData` in the `False` case?
issueDTO.description:
#7138 lowers down the cost of `equalsData` when the two `Data` objects aren't equal. It would be great to have lower cost for `equalsData`, but implementing it properly is quite challenging, so we should first check if the impact is worth the trouble.

This issue is for replaying all the on-chain evaluation events using the #7138 branch recording the budget and success results. We're interested in:

- what percentage (+ an absolute number) of total script executions gets 0-1% cheaper
- 2-5%
- 5-10%
- 10-15%
- ...
- 95-100%
- whether any of the script executions gets more expensive (that would be a bug)

issueDTO.title: Camunda/Zeebe SDK Client silently accepts configuration issue
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug** **To Reproduce** 1. Checkout and build [Camunda Example Twitter](https://github.com/camunda-community-hub/camunda-8-examples/tree/main/twitter-review-java-springboot) 2. Set appropriate configuration properties to connect to your cluster/instance ``` zeebe.client.cloud.clusterId=... zeebe.client.cloud.clientId=SJqG7ve.... zeebe.client.cloud.clientSecret=... zeebe.client.cloud.region=... zeebe.client.cloud.auth-url=... zeebe.client.cloud.base-url=... ``` 3. Set environment variable ``` ZEEBE_CLIENT_CONFIG_PATH=/tmp ``` 4. Run the application and see some errors on the console regarding authentication issues. ``` at io.camunda.zeebe.client.impl.ZeebeClientFutureImpl.join(ZeebeClientFutureImpl.java:52) ~[zeebe-client-java-8.6.7.jar:8.6.7] ... 32 common frames omitted Caused by: io.grpc.StatusRuntimeException: UNAUTHENTICATED: HTTP status code 401 invalid content-type: text/html headers: Metadata(:status=401,date=Fri, 24 Jan 2025 14:49:06 GMT,content-type=text/html,www-authenticate=Bearer token_type="JWT",strict-transport-security=max-age=63072000; includeSubDomains,content-length=172) DATA----------------------------- 401 Authorization Required

401 Authorization Required

nginx
``` **Expected behavior** For a better developer experience, the client should at least log an error to the console. But ideally should abort the bootstrapping with a useful error message mentioning which property is wrongly configured. **Log/Stacktrace** 👀 **We do indeed raise an exception, when a directory is configured instead of a file (see [here](https://github.com/camunda/camunda/blob/ed8a807969f040fdb55b575a9e31fef957fd8d5e/clients/java/src/main/java/io/camunda/zeebe/client/impl/oauth/OAuthCredentialsProviderBuilder.java#L251)) and the exception bubbles up to `PropertyUtil.java` (see [here](https://github.com/camunda/camunda/blob/cbef3b18134bbd4198456c293206bef2eab726f9/clients/spring-boot-starter-camunda-sdk/src/main/java/io/camunda/zeebe/spring/client/configuration/PropertyUtil.java#L98)) where the error is logged with `DEBUG` level!** 👀 Thus in order to see the message on the console the log level of the spring application needs to be changed (You will still see a lot of noise on the log, because the client still continues to bootstrap) ``` logging.level.root=DEBUG ``` See stack trace and error message below.

issueDTO.title: [BUG] Unable to load XML files
issueDTO.description:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do not delete this template ⚠️⚠️ -->

<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Playwright release to see if your issue has already been fixed -->
<!-- 💡 Provide enough information for us to be able to reproduce your issue locally -->

### System info
- Playwright Version: v1.52.3
- Operating System: Debian 12
- Browser: Chromium
- Other info:

### Source code
N/A

**Steps**
- Make a request for a valid XML file (e.g. https://www.aldi.nl/sitemaps/.aldi-nord-sitemap-products.xml)

**Expected**
- Playwright successfully requests the file and the contents is correctly loaded

**Actual**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fb4f7437-894a-49c2-b79d-e706b4f1a5de)
(we get an `xmlParseEntityRef: no name` error)

**Extra Notes**
- The bug only manifests when using chrome (either the google-stable binary or the playwright bundled chrome); firefox is unaffected and successfully loads the XML file.
- If we run without patchright and just use vanilla playwright (with exactly the same chrome browser binary, args etc.) the XML file is requested and loaded without issue
- Issue is also not present with Rebrowser+Puppeteer+Chrome. The only combo that triggers this bug is patchright+chrome)

issueDTO.title: feat: support inserting documents as a trait
issueDTO.description:
- [x] I have looked for existing issues (including closed) about this

## Feature Request
<!--
High level description of the requested feature or improvement.
-->
Currently, every vector store provider integration that we have has an `insert_documents` method. It would be a great idea to formalise this as a trait. By doing so:
- We can reference this method without the compiler needing to know what type it is
- We can ensure that this behaviour is guaranteed across vector stores.

This would also be a good chance to implement a new, different type of `insert_docs` method that also takes a user-defined ID generation strategy (although perhaps out of initial scope for the first PR).

### Motivation
<!--
Please describe the use case(s) or other motivation for the new feature.
-->
Better UX, better type reusability.

### Proposal
<!--
How should the new feature be implemented, and why? Add any considered
drawbacks.
-->
Move all `insert_document` methods under a new `InsertDocuments` trait.

### Alternatives
<!--
Are there other ways to solve this problem that you've considered? What are
their potential drawbacks? Why was the proposed solution chosen over these
alternatives?
-->

issueDTO.title: 📣 Call for contributions!
issueDTO.description:
# 🌟 Open Call for Contributions: Gemma 3n Recipes 💎

Hello community! 👋

We got really excited last week with the full release of [Gemma 3n](https://huggingface.co/blog/gemma3n) 💎 by Google DeepMind. With that, we’d like to open this call for contributions to explore the amazing recipes the community can build with it!

This project follows the same principles as our previous [Hugging Face Llama Recipes](https://github.com/huggingface/huggingface-llama-recipes), which you might also want to check out. You can refer to that repository to see the previous [call for contributions](https://github.com/huggingface/huggingface-llama-recipes/issues/43) and discover what the community created. You may also want to browse the [Gemma Cookbook](https://github.com/google-gemini/gemma-cookbook) for further inspiration.

> Star the project to boost it! :star:

## 💡 What You Could Build

Gemma 3n is specifically designed for low-resource (on-device) environments and is a **multimodal model** that supports text, image, video, and audio inputs — so we’d love to see projects where those capabilities shine! ✨ We highly recommend checking out the [blog post](https://huggingface.co/blog/gemma3n) to better understand the possibilities and spark your creativity.

You could:
- Showcase agentic or interactive uses of the model
- Build recipes using `transformers`, `llama.cpp`, or `transformers.js`
- Create fine-tuning notebooks for domain-specific tasks using any of the supported modalities
- Or anything else that pushes the boundaries of on-device and multimodal AI! 🤖

Have your own idea?💡 Even better, we’d love to hear it!

## 📝 How to Contribute

1. **Open a New Issue**
   - If you’re interested in contributing, please [open a new issue](#) with a descriptive title.
   - Use the issue to outline your idea and gather early feedback.

2. **Let Us Know**
   - Comment on this post to let us know you’ve opened a new issue. We’ll update the main list with a link to your idea.

3. **Start Building**
   - Once you’ve shaped your plan, go ahead and implement your idea 👨‍💻.

4. **Submit a Pull Request**
   - When you’re ready, open a Pull Request (PR) that links back to your issue.
   - Mention the issue in your PR description so it's easy to track.

5. **Update the README**
   - Don’t forget to add a short description of your contribution to the `README.md`, so others can find and reuse it easily.

## 💬 For New Contributors

If you’re just starting out in open source, we recommend reading our [Contribution Guide](https://github.com/huggingface/huggingface-gemma-recipes/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md). It includes helpful tips to get you up and running.

We can’t wait to see what we’ll build together! 🤠

Hi @sergiopaniego 👋

I’ve just opened **two** Gemma 3n‑recipe proposals that show the model’s edge‑device super‑powers in very different domains:

---

### 🛒 Issue #7 – “ShopAI: Multimodal Order Extraction with Gemma 3n”

👉 [https://github.com/huggingface/huggingface-gemma-recipes/issues/7#issue-3195036130](https://github.com/huggingface/huggingface-gemma-recipes/issues/7#issue-3195036130)

* **True multimodal demo** — text 📝 + speech 🎙️ + vision 📷 in one recipe.
* **Retail‑ready workflow** — a casual request (“Add 2 kg sugar…”) or a product photo becomes structured order lines.
* **Semantic inventory match** — ChromaDB embeddings link items to the store catalog, showing live stock levels.
* **Drop‑in backend** — FastAPI endpoints for any voice assistant, chatbot, or web store.

---

### ♻️ Issue #9 – “SmartTrash: On‑Device Trash Classification & Sorting with Gemma 3n”

👉 [https://github.com/huggingface/huggingface-gemma-recipes/issues/9#issue-3195525836](https://github.com/huggingface/huggingface-gemma-recipes/issues/9#issue-3195525836)

* **Edge‑AI sustainability** — Gemma 3n vision model runs on a low‑power SBC to classify paper, metal, glass, plastic & other waste.
* **Real‑time sorting** — a camera‑equipped dust‑bin and simple servos route each item to the right compartment.
* **Fully open source** — code, embedded inference pipeline, CAD files, electronics schematics, and parts list will all be published.
* **STEM‑friendly** — perfect hands‑on project for schools and makers interested in AI + robotics + environment.

---

Would love any feedback on model fine‑tuning tricks, vision/audio pipeline optimizations, or ways to make these two recipes flagship showcases for on‑device Gemma 3n. Thanks for the inspiration, and looking forward to collaborating! 🚀

issueDTO.title: VTag: Use computed property for router link
issueDTO.description:
```html
<router-link
  :to="{ name: 'home-tag', params: { tag: name } }"
  :class="className"
>
```

Ideally, `{ name: 'home-tag', params: { tag: name } }` should be a computed property and then used like:

```html
<router-link
  :to="homeLink"
  :class="className"
>
```

Related resources:

-  https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/computed.html

issueDTO.title: KVstore delete task - missclassified properties
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the issue

io.kestra.plugin.core.kv.Delete

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9b94ecc6-9f50-4f9f-82f6-f05089fee1b1)

should at least provide a key and a namespace

### Environment

- Kestra Version: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7aa2be5c-11a0-42ed-b4a9-e169faa7129f)
comments: Both are mandatory in code, it's a frontend issue.

Both are sent to UI as `required: false` @loicmathieu.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/246ea0d1-1ff3-420c-aeb2-f740dc60c239)

Yes, flow is valid and documentation doesn't show required on these properties

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c4f272ae-53eb-4349-9f45-e48cf77af33c)

So it's consistent with the doc.
It's a consequence of https://github.com/kestra-io/kestra/issues/7406
So in the end the issue is valid: key and namespaces should be required properties
If the properties are changed to be required on the `BE` side, `UI` will automatically show them as such. For that reason, I'm amending the labels here.

repository.description: :zap: Workflow Automation Platform. Orchestrate & Schedule code in any language, run anywhere, 600+ plugins. Alternative to Airflow, n8n, Rundeck, VMware vRA, Zapier ...
repository.name: kestra

summary.main: The issue is about KVstore delete task - missclassified properties, specifically that io.kestra.plugin.core.kv.Delete should provide a key and a namespace, and these properties should be required.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The properties should at least provide a key and a namespace, and the key and namespaces should be required properties.
summary.attemptedFixes: The issue is a frontend issue and the flow is valid, documentation doesn't show required on these properties, and it's consistent with the doc.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is a consequence of #7406 and is valid, key and namespaces should be required properties. Changing properties to be required on the BE side will automatically show them as required on the UI.

issueDTO.title: Create Archive Folder if None Exists
issueDTO.description:
### Checklist

- [X] I have used the search function to see if someone else has already submitted the same bug report.
- [X] I will describe the problem with as much detail as possible.

### App

Thunderbird for Android

### App version

8.0b4

### Where did you get the app from?

Google Play

### Android version

14

### Device model

Samsung Galaxy S23

### Steps to reproduce

Attempt to archive an email without an archive folder, It fails.

### Expected behavior

Thunderbird desktop creates an archive folder when a message is archived - even if an archive folder doesn't exist. TB for Android should do the same.

### Actual behavior

Currently Thunderbird for Android does not generate an archive folder.

### Logs

_No response_
comments: Related to #7062 ?
Coming back to this, @kewisch I do think we should bring this inline with desktop.

Sounds reasonable. I think we'll have to explore:

* Can we differentiate between no archive folder set because of explicit user choice, or because no decision made? I think yes, if the "Auto" setting is on for the archive folder.
* How well does this work for providers like Gmail that have special archive folders, and for the case where TfA might not have detected the archive folder correctly?
* Do we need to do anything special for localization? See also #6799 

This probably isn't terribly complicated, I'll mark this as a good first bug.
We may be tackling this as part of https://github.com/thunderbird/thunderbird-android/issues/7062 . If someone wants to work on this please check in beforehand.
@rafaeltonholo by chance did you do this as part of #7062?

> [@rafaeltonholo](https://github.com/rafaeltonholo) by chance did you do this as part of [#7062](https://github.com/thunderbird/thunderbird-android/issues/7062)?

Currently, folder creation only occurs with a swipe gesture. To implement this functionality, the following steps are necessary:

1. Add a new step in the "Setup Archive Folder" dialog to list the accounts associated with the selected messages.
2. Once the user selects an account, proceed with creating the folder.
3. Ensure that the dialog does not dismiss after the folder is created if more than one account requires an archive folder.
4. Execute the archiving action only after the folder creation is complete.

issueDTO.title: Avoid excessive use of `toarray` in unit tests
issueDTO.description:
Many of our unit tests compute the 2-norm of an error vector and compare it to a given tolerance. To this aim, unfortunately, they often convert a Psydac vector to a NumPy array, which is unnecessarily expensive:
```python
error = a - b
assert np.linalg.norm(error.toarray()) < TOL
```
Instead, the same result can be obtained by using the method `inner` of our `Vector` objects, without any unnecessary memory allocation:
```python
# Define 2-norm of vector using inner
norm2 = lambda v: sqrt(v.inner(v))

error = a - b
assert norm2(error) < TOL
```
comments:
While refactoring the `test_operator_evaluation` function (`/linalg/tests/test_linalg.py`) to remove all `.toarray() `(to better leverage PSYDAC’s native vector/matrix structures and improve efficiency), I noticed that the current computation of the variable `error_est` relies on a full dense inverse via:

```
Bmat = B.toarray()

B_inv_mat = np.linalg.inv(Bmat)
b_inv_arr = np.matrix.flatten(B_inv_mat)
error_est = 2 + n1 * n2 * np.max([np.abs(b_inv_arr[i]) for i in range(len(b_inv_arr))])

```
Since we’re avoiding those dense NumPy operations for performance and memory reasons, I believe this calculation of `error_est` no longer fits well in the new context. Computing the full inverse matrix is computationally expensive and somewhat contradictory to the iterative sparse methods we’re testing.

Could you suggest an alternative approach for `error_est`?
For example, I’m considering replacing it with a simpler, lightweight estimate such as:

`error_est = {some num > 0}* n1 * n2`

This is an error estimate based on the maximum absolute value of the inverse matrix. It could read in fact
```python
error_est = np.linalg.norm(Bmat.flat, np.inf)
```
which is the inf-norm of the vectorized matrix. This does not seem to give a sharp estimate, given that it is multiplied by a small number just below (`tol = 1e-5`). Maybe @jowezarek could shed some light on this?

@anushkasinghh @yguclu 
Thanks for bringing this up, this code snipped is ridiculously complicated and doesn't do what it's supposed to do :')

The explicit matrix inverse was never truly needed, and yet there's no time to gain as the entire test ran in < 3 seconds on my machine.

This particular part of the test was designed to test whether power operations (**0, **1, **2) work with inverse linear operators (ILOs).

The poorly executed idea of the test was the following:
```python
# arbitrary tolerance
tol = 

# Define 2-norm of vector using inner (as proposed by Yaman)
norm2 = lambda v: sqrt(v.inner(v))

# Psydac objects, solver with tolerance = tol
u
B_ILO = inverse(B, 'cg', tol=tol)

# First test: Check whether B_ILO**0 is the identity matrix (B_ILO**0 = id?)

error = (B_ILO**0) @ u - u
assert norm2(error) < 1e-15 # error should really be zero

# Second test: Check whether B_ILO**1 really computes the inverse up to accuracy (B_ILO**1 = B_ILO?)
# I.e., we expect B @ B_ILO**1 @ u to be equal to u + err, err a vector of norm less than tol

error = B @ B_ILO**1 @ u - u
assert norm2(error) < tol

# Third test: Now checking whether B_ILO**2 is really equal to a double application of B_ILO (B_ILO**2 = B_ILO @ B_ILO?)
# B @ B @ B_ILO @ B_ILO @ u = B @ ( B_ILO @ u + err1 ) = u + err2 + B @ err1
# where both err1 and err2 are vectors of norm less than tol, hence
# | B @ B @ B_ILO @ B_ILO @ u - u | = | err2 + B @ err1 | < | err2 | + | B @ err1 | < tol + |B|_{inf} * tol = (1 + |B|_{inf}) * tol

adjusted_tol = ( 1 + np.max(np.abs(B.toarray())) ) * tol
error = B @ B @ B_ILO**2 @ u - u
assert norm2(error) < adjusted_tol

repository.description: Python 3 library for isogeometric analysis
repository.name: psydac

summary.main: The main issue is to refactor the unit tests to avoid excessive use of `toarray` and instead use the `inner` method of Psydac vector objects to compute the 2-norm of an error vector.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The requirement is to avoid unnecessary memory allocation and improve efficiency by leveraging Psydac's native vector/matrix structures.
summary.attemptedFixes: Refactoring the `test_operator_evaluation` function to remove all `.toarray()` calls, and replacing the calculation of `error_est` with a simpler estimate.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about avoiding excessive use of `toarray` in unit tests, and instead using the `inner` method of Psydac vector objects to compute the 2-norm of an error vector. Additionally, there is a suggestion to replace the calculation of `error_est` with a simpler estimate.

issueDTO.title: Verify signature locally
issueDTO.description:
## Description 📹

**Currently, verifying signatures on Starknet via `is_valid_signature` fails if the account is not deployed. This leads to the error: "your wallet is not yet initialized, please make a transaction (sending ETH to yourself works) to initialize it." To support undeployed accounts, we propose directly verifying the signature using the public key (account address), bypassing the need to interact with the account's contract.**

## Proposed Actions 🛠️

Here’s a checklist of actions to follow for resolving this issue:

1. **Fork and Create Branch**:  
   Fork the repository and create a new branch using the issue number:
   
```bash
   git checkout -b fix-[issue-number]
```

2. **Implement Changes**:  
- [ ] Create a utility function to verify Starknet signatures using public keys directly.
- [ ] Integrate this function as a fallback when account is not yet deployed.
- [ ] Detect if an account is deployed or not before calling `is_valid_signature`.
- [ ] Add error handling and logging for both methods of verification.
- [ ] Write unit tests for both deployed and undeployed account scenarios.

Example snippet for direct signature verification:
```python
def verify_signature(pubkey, message_hash, signature):
    # Apply Starknet signature verification logic using elliptic curve math
    return starknet_ec_verify(pubkey, message_hash, signature)
```

3. **Run Tests and Commit Changes**:  
   Make sure your changes don't break existing functionality and commit with a clear message:
   
```bash
   git commit -m "Fix: Allow signature verification for undeployed Starknet accounts"
```

## Required 📋

To keep our workflow smooth, please make sure you follow these guidelines:

- **Assignment**: Don't create a pull request if you weren’t assigned to this issue.
- **Timeframe**: Complete the task within **3 business days**.
- **Closing the Issue**: In your PR description, close the issue by writing Close #[issue_id].
- **Review Process**:
  - Once you've submitted your PR, change the label to **"ready for review"**.
  - If changes are requested, address them and then update the label back to **"ready for review"** once done.
- **Testing**: Test your PR locally before pushing, and verify that tests and build are working after pushing.

Thank you for your contribution 🙏

⚠️ WARNING: Failure to follow the requirements above may result in being added to the OnlyDust blacklist, affecting your ability to receive future rewards.

issueDTO.title: [Bug Report]: OpenAI Provider Returns 404 Error While Direct API Calls Work Fine
issueDTO.description: ### Version agent-tars/0.2.7 darwin-arm64 node-v22.17.0 ### Issue Type - [ ] Select a issue type 👇 - [ ] Agent TARS Web UI (`@agent-tars/web-ui`) - [ ] Agent TARS CLI (`@agent-tars/server`) - [ ] Agent TARS Server (`@agent-tars/server`) - [x] Agent TARS (`@agent-tars/core`) - [ ] MCP Agent (`@mcp-agent/core`) - [ ] Agent Kernel (`@multimodal/agent`) - [ ] Other (please specify in description) ### Model Provider - [ ] Select a model provider 👇 - [ ] Volcengine - [ ] Anthropic - [x] OpenAI - [ ] Azure OpenAI - [ ] Other (please specify in description) ### Problem Description ## Bug Description Agent TARS consistently returns "404 Resource not found" error when using the OpenAI provider, despite direct OpenAI API calls working correctly with the same API key and network configuration. ## Environment - **Network**: China mainland with proxy configuration - **Proxy**: 127.0.0.1:4780 ## Problem Summary ### ❌ **OpenAI Provider** (FAILS) - **Provider**: `openai` - **Model**: `gpt-4o` - **API Key**: Valid (verified with curl) - **Error**: `404 Resource not found` - **Occurs in**: Both CLI and Web UI ### ✅ **Direct OpenAI API Call** (WORKS) ```bash curl -x http://127.0.0.1:4780 https://api.openai.com/v1/models \ -H "Authorization: Bearer $OPENAI_API_KEY" # Returns normal model list successfully ``` ## Reproduction Steps ### Command Line ```bash agent-tars run \ --input "Find information about UI TARS" \ --model.provider openai \ --model.id gpt-4o \ --model.apiKey {my-api-key} \ --format json ``` **Result:** ```json { "sessionId": "3zvvbfEkWEIYgS2Iz19Nm", "result": { "id": "3526d2b3-bcde-40a2-beb0-9abb1bb6b322", "type": "assistant_message", "timestamp": 1751442535990, "content": "Sorry, an error occurred while processing your request: Error: 404 Resource not found", "finishReason": "error" } ``` ### Web UI ```bash agent-tars \ --provider openai \ --model gpt-4o \ --apiKey {my-api-key} ``` **Result:** Same "404 Resource not found" error in web interface. ## Evidence That API Key and Network Are Valid ### Direct API Verification ```bash # Test 1: List models curl -x http://127.0.0.1:4780 https://api.openai.com/v1/models \ -H "Authorization: Bearer $OPENAI_API_KEY" # ✅ SUCCESS: Returns complete model list # Test 2: Chat completion curl -x http://127.0.0.1:4780 https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions \ -H "Authorization: Bearer $OPENAI_API_KEY" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '{"model":"gpt-4o","messages":[{"role":"user","content":"Hi"}],"max_tokens":1}' # ✅ SUCCESS: Returns valid response ``` Both direct API calls work perfectly with the same API key and proxy configuration. ## Configuration Attempted ```typescript // agent-tars.config.ts import { defineConfig } from '@agent-tars/interface'; export default defineConfig({ model: { provider: 'openai', id: 'gpt-4o', apiKey: process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY, }, browser: { control: 'dom', }, }); ``` ## Comparison with Other Providers - **Doubao (volcengine)**: ✅ Works perfectly in Agent TARS - **OpenAI**: ❌ 404 error in Agent TARS, ✅ works with direct API calls I'm wondering if this issue is related to my local environment, or Agent TARS itself. Thank you! ### Error Logs

issueDTO.title: layers control closes too quickly
issueDTO.description:
### Checklist

- [x] I've looked at the [documentation](https://leafletjs.com/reference.html) to make sure the behavior isn't documented and expected.
- [x] I'm sure this is an issue with Leaflet, not with my app or other dependencies (Angular, Cordova, React, etc.).
- [x] I've searched through the [current issues](https://github.com/Leaflet/Leaflet/issues) to make sure this hasn't been reported yet.
- [x] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/Leaflet/Leaflet/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to.

### Steps to reproduce

Users are complaining that the layer control disappears too quickly. Especially when you have a long list of layers, its quite tedious to move the mouse cursor down without leaving the hover state. A transition or transition-delay would help, however I have been unable to implement this with pure css. 

I have found a workaround by triggering the collapse manually, however its causes other issues, like re-entering while not clearing older timeouts. Probably needs a debounce fn.
https://plnkr.co/edit/WQyfFctUqs7mNdq9

On another note, a collapseDelay option would work really well to make it customizable.

### Expected behavior

Layer control stays for 1-2 seconds after leaving hover state.

### Current behavior

Layer control disappears instantly after leaving hover state

### Minimal example reproducing the issue

_No response_

### Environment

- Leaflet version: 1.9.3
- Browser (with version): Chrome
- OS/Platform (with version): Mac/Windows latest
comments:
@fyyyyy This is kinda easy, so I would encourage you to try and send a PR for it.

It's about adding a `setTimeout()` at https://github.com/Leaflet/Leaflet/blob/58c267b7c1c530b238742c7f0054abdc11d43054/src/control/Control.Layers.js#L180

...and then storing the return value of that `setTimeout()` call in a class private(ish) property, and calling `clearTimeout()` in the `expand()` method. No need for debounce nor throttle; a flag is sufficient.

Probably there's also a need for a new option in the class, in order to specify the duration of the timeout.
> [@fyyyyy](https://github.com/fyyyyy) This is kinda easy, so I would encourage you to try and send a PR for it.

The PR and test is ready, just needs review

summary.main: The layer control in Leaflet closes too quickly, especially when there is a long list of layers. The expected behavior is for the layer control to stay for 1-2 seconds after leaving the hover state, but the current behavior is that it disappears instantly.

summary.otherNotes: The issue is about the layer control in Leaflet closing too quickly, especially when there is a long list of layers. A workaround has been found, but it needs a debounce function. A collapseDelay option would also be useful for customization.

issueDTO.title: API client to throw error instead of None
issueDTO.description:
The Api client should  `raise_for_status()` instead of `None` if there is an error. Like this we can call the API client and give a more meaningful error to the user.

Things to consider:
* The API client should throw but the emissionsTracker should not break, this means that we should try-catch in the emissions tracker.
* One should check as well if in any of the responses we are `if response is None` because now they will throw the error

_Originally posted by @inimaz in https://github.com/mlco2/codecarbon/issues/798#issuecomment-2800035595_
comments: Would be happy to take this one if it's still relevant :)

Noticed a couple of other things when trying to get env setup. 

- project could benefit from using `uv` for dependency resolution (on install and pip compile)

eg. (not sure this is complete, more info [here](https://juftin.com/hatch-pip-compile/#configuration-options)

```
# pyproject.toml

[tool.hatch.envs.default]
# pip-compile automate the export of environments.txt
type = "pip-compile"
installer = "uv"
pip-compile-resolver = "uv"
```

- python3.8 tests do not work as installing `urllib==2.5.0` is not possible on py3.8
- test deps don't seem to be separated from build deps
- setting `CODECARBON_ALLOW_MULTIPLE_RUNS` env variable could be done with `pytest-dotenv` setting in `pytest.ini` and adding a `.env.test` file 

All except the second one are somewhat debatable, so not sure the best place to put them - happy to elaborate.

Hello @bcmyguest It is still relevant! Feel free to take it/ask for any questions.

- About the use of `uv`, I agree. I see @benoit-cty already started [a branch to migrate ](https://github.com/mlco2/codecarbon/pull/815) maybe it can be discussed in that PR?
- About test deps not separated from build deps. I think this is only true for the env `api`. Thanks for pointing out. We use it to deploy our API, we could separate it into `api-test` and `api`.
- And about the `pytest.ini`, indeed go ahead!

Hello,
Yes, we would like to switch to UV. I stopped my PR has I don't know how to migrate some part, which I do not write done :-(. I can do the rebase tomorrow and check what is left to do.

Thanks for contributing !

issueDTO.title: setup devcontainer
issueDTO.description:
## 🧱 Devcontainer Setup for Unified Development Environment

### 🎯 Goal

Provide a consistent development environment via Devcontainers to reduce onboarding friction and tooling issues across contributors. This image will be used by all SCORE-related repositories (dozens in total), so it must be robust, reusable, and actively maintained.

---

### ✅ Current Situation

We currently require a number of tools to be installed in addition to Bazel. This includes Python, Graphviz, Bazelisk, and shell autocompletion for Bazel. These tools are not always easy to install correctly across different systems, especially for new contributors.

---

### 🚀 Solution

Implement a reusable Devcontainer setup based on a Docker image that includes all required tools preinstalled. The image should be published to GitHub Container Registry (GHCR) and referenced via `.devcontainer/devcontainer.json` or `.devcontainer.json` in consuming repositories.

**Target image name:** `ghcr.io/eclipse-score/devcontainer`

The base image should include:

- Based on an extended Ubuntu image, quite certainly:
  - `mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/python:1.2-3.12`
- Preinstalled tools:
  - Python (needed for Bazel formatting bug workaround)
  - Graphviz
  - Bazelisk (with current bazel version pre-downloaded)
  - Shell autocompletion for Bazel

---

### 🛠️ Concrete Tasks

- [ ] Create a new GitHub repository (name: `eclipse-score/devcontainer`)
- [ ] Create a `Dockerfile` that installs all required tools
- [ ] Add GitHub Actions workflow to:
  - Build the image
  - Optional: Tag it with semantic version (e.g. `v1.0.0`) and `latest`
  - Push to GHCR under `ghcr.io/eclipse-score/devcontainer`
- [ ] Optional: Add typical metadata to the container
- [ ] Use the image from GHCR in `.devcontainer/devcontainer.json` or `.devcontainer.json` in at least one repo (e.g. `score`)
- [ ] Verify that all tools are functional inside the container
- [ ] Optional: Add documentation (`README.md`) to `eclipse-score/devcontainer`

---

### 🔄 Considered Alternatives

Some tools could theoretically be installed via Bazel, but this was previously evaluated and rejected due to high implementation and maintenance cost. We chose to use system-level tools with clear documentation instead.

---

### 🧠 Notes

- The image will become the base for all development work across the SCORE ecosystem
- Keep it generic, stable, and easy to extend.
- This devcontainer will remain entirely optional, it's just meant to ease the pain of installing all the required tools.

---

### 📚 References

- Example: [`eclipse-score/score/.devcontainer`](https://github.com/eclipse-score/score/tree/main/.devcontainer)
- Docs: [Development Environment Setup](https://eclipse-score.github.io/score/main/contribute/development/development_environment.html#autocompletion-in-the-shell)
comments: This looks quite interesting, I will take a look!
I think I will have a first iteration of a devcontainer ready rather soon. We should then discuss if that is the right thing and how to proceed. I will update this ticket with comments.
@opajonk looking at your draft you should consider starting with mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/python:1.2-3.12 instead if raw ubuntu

I checked also `mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/python:1.2-3.12`. However, that one is based on Debian instead of Ubuntu. A few of the tools have packages which are created for specific Ubuntu releases only. Also, I'd argue that Ubuntu is more often used in "commercial contexts". S-CORE is Open Source, of course, but the primary usage is commercial. Hence, using a commercially supported OS has advantages.

Fine with me, so far I'm workin in that container, but I don't care which one it is, as long as it's working :-)

IMHO `mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/base:ubuntu` would make sense then.

> Beyond git, this image / Dockerfile includes zsh, [Oh My Zsh!](https://ohmyz.sh/), a non-root vscode user with sudo access, and a set of common dependencies for development.

It's not a lot. But it's not nothing. You could also use the features directly instead: https://github.com/devcontainers/images/blob/main/src/base-ubuntu/.devcontainer/devcontainer.json

issueDTO.title: feat: Add optional "cancel reminder" for recurring subscriptions
issueDTO.description:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/rarfell/dimeApp/issues) that already include this feature request, without success.

### Describe the Feature Request

I’d love to have a feature that allows users to set customizable reminder notifications a few days before a recurring expense, especially for subscriptions. This way users get a heads-up and have a chance to cancel before the payment goes through.

### Describe the Use Case

I add a recurring subscription payment (e.g. Spotify on the 15th of each month).
I'd like the option to set a reminder X days before (e.g. 3 days before), so Dime sends me a notification like:

“Your Spotify subscription is going to renew in 3 days — consider canceling if you don’t need it.”

This reduces the risk of forgetting to cancel and incurring charges for services I don’t use anymore.

### Additional Information

_No response_
comments: Hey! this is a great idea—let's look into it.

Hello, that sounds really good.  I have a suggestion that may be related to this issue:

It would be great if the **recurring subscription/expense could have an end date or repeat times.**  
For example, I would sign a contract with the gym for 15 months. In this case, I don't want to bother adding an expense monthly or ending this recurring expense while keeping it in my mind.

Anyway, thanks for the app; I loved it at first glance.

At the login screen, sometimes we need to enter a verification code received by email, likely when we sign up on a new device. This email verification input field appears after providing the correct username and password.

issueDTO.title: 🐛 Bug Report: SMTP username and password aren't validated when updating SMTP settings
issueDTO.description:
### 👟 Reproduction steps

1. Update a project's SMTP settings
2. Use a valid host, port, and secure protocol, but an incorrect username and password
3. Click Update

### 👍 Expected behavior

The update should fail because the username and password are incorrect.

### 👎 Actual Behavior

The SMTP settings are updated successfully.

We use `$mail->SmtpConnecti()` test the connection:

https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/8e021158286cd04b64b391afe86975e23368a52c/app/controllers/api/projects.php#L1684-L1695

However, because `SMTPAuth` isn't set to true, the username and password are not checked.

We need to set `SMTPAuth` like we do in the worker:

https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/8e021158286cd04b64b391afe86975e23368a52c/src/Appwrite/Platform/Workers/Mails.php#L166

### 🎲 Appwrite version

Appwrite Cloud

Linux

_No response_

issueDTO.title: Rename Zeebe Cluster to Orchestration Cluster in Deployment Modal
issueDTO.description:
### What should we do?

Rename Zeebe Cluster to Orchestration Cluster in Deployment Modal at least vor version 8.8+

### Why should we do it?

With our streamlined architecture we talk about Orchestration Cluster instead of a Zeebe cluster.
This should be aligned in Desktop Modeler deployment modal

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7b37735a-e2b0-482e-8139-ddbc8f324aa0)
comments: Probably worth to simply rename it consistently, across all Camunda 8 versions.
Do we want to change all occurrences of Zeebe? I noticed another error `Unsupported Zeebe version`, Would `Unsupported Engine version` be better?

> Do we want to change all occurrences of Zeebe? I noticed another error Unsupported Zeebe version, Would Unsupported Engine version be better?

We want to rename to orchestration cluster:

```
Unsupported Zeebe version -> Unsupported orchestration cluster version
```

This should also be reflected across [the documentation](https://docs.camunda.io/docs/next/components/modeler/desktop-modeler/), but we have to ensure to not break existing links used from within the modeler UI, i.e. [this](https://docs.camunda.io/docs/next/components/modeler/desktop-modeler/troubleshooting/#i-cannot-connect-to-zeebe); if we break, then we have to redirect old ones.

issueDTO.title: Feature: Add entity and keyword extraction capabilities
issueDTO.description:
**Description:**
Implement entity and keyword extraction to identify important information like names, locations, dates, and key terms from extracted text.

**Requirements:**
1. Support basic entity types: PERSON, ORGANIZATION, LOCATION, DATE, EMAIL, PHONE
2. Support keyword extraction using TF-IDF or similar algorithms
3. Make this an optional feature with its own dependency group
4. Results should include entity type, text, and position information
5. Support custom entity patterns via regex

**Implementation Details:**
- Add optional dependency group:
  ```toml
  optional-dependencies.entity-extraction = [
    "gliner>=0.2.0",  # State-of-the-art zero-shot NER, outperforms spaCy
    "keybert>=0.8.0",  # Most accurate keyword extraction
  ]
  ```
- **Library Choice Rationale**: 
  - Use GLiNER for NER based on 2024 benchmarks showing superior zero-shot performance and flexibility compared to spaCy
  - Use KeyBERT for keyword extraction as it provides the highest accuracy among RAKE, YAKE, and KeyBERT
- Add to `ExtractionConfig`:
  ```python
  extract_entities: bool = False
  extract_keywords: bool = False
  keyword_count: int = 10
  custom_entity_patterns: dict[str, str] | None = None  # {"INVOICE_ID": r"INV-\d+"}
  ```
- Add to `ExtractionResult`:
  ```python
  entities: list[Entity] | None = None
  keywords: list[tuple[str, float]] | None = None  # (keyword, score)
  ```
- Create `kreuzberg/_entity_extraction.py` module
- Define `Entity` dataclass with `type`, `text`, `start`, `end` fields

**Testing Requirements:**
- Test entity extraction on various document types
- Test custom pattern matching
- Test keyword extraction with different document lengths
- Mock spacy models in unit tests
- Test handling of missing dependencies
- Verify performance impact is acceptable
comments: I have hands-on experience with Python and NLP libraries like spaCy and NLTK. I've built entity and keyword extraction features before and can deliver clean, well-documented code. I'm reliable, quick to learn, and committed to making valuable contributions to open-source.
go ahead

summary.attemptedFixes: None mentioned in the issue description, but the author has offered to contribute and deliver clean, well-documented code.
summary.otherNotes: The issue description provides a clear outline of the requirements and implementation details for adding entity and keyword extraction capabilities. The author has provided a detailed explanation of the library choices and testing requirements.

issueDTO.title: [Blazor] Throw meaningful exception for JSRuntime calls that timeout
issueDTO.description:
Capturing the direction on this into a new issue. We should throw a more meaningful exception to users if JS interop invocations timeout.

Ref: #18875 #21375
comments: @captainsafia can you please fill in the details on what a solution would look like here? Thanks!

We've moved this issue to the Backlog milestone. This means that it is not going to be worked on for the coming release. We will reassess the backlog following the current release and consider this item at that time. To learn more about our issue management process and to have better expectation regarding different types of issues you can read our [Triage Process](https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/blob/master/docs/TriageProcess.md).

The fix for this issue will need to be implemented in the `ComponentBase` class ([ref](https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/blob/5e49fc336e4464711ff2a8db2e00b9bafb518c78/src/Components/Components/src/ComponentBase.cs)).

Specifically, the exception handling logic that is in question is [here](https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/blob/5e49fc336e4464711ff2a8db2e00b9bafb518c78/src/Components/Components/src/ComponentBase.cs#L247). Currently, we ignore all exceptions that occur because a task was cancelled.

We need to add an additional check if the cancellation occurred due to a timeout and throw an exception with a specific message if that is the case.

We've moved this issue to the Backlog milestone. This means that it is not going to be worked on for the coming release. We will reassess the backlog following the current release and consider this item at that time. To learn more about our issue management process and to have better expectation regarding different types of issues you can read our [Triage Process](https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/blob/master/docs/TriageProcess.md).

Thanks for contacting us.

We're moving this issue to the `.NET 9 Planning` milestone for future evaluation / consideration. We would like to keep this around to collect more feedback, which can help us with prioritizing this work. We will re-evaluate this issue, during our next planning meeting(s). 
If we later determine, that the issue has no community involvement, or it's very rare and low-impact issue, we will close it - so that the team can focus on more important and high impact issues.
To learn more about what to expect next and how this issue will be handled you can read more about our triage process [here](https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/blob/main/docs/TriageProcess.md).

issueDTO.title: Bug in proxy-cache plugin returning compressed cached content to clients not supporting compression
issueDTO.description:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Kong version (`$ kong version`)

Kong Enterprise 3.6.1.1

### Current Behavior

I've got reports from users from my API that they get compressed output when the response was cached from another user.

Lets say for instance a `/api/healthz` page is called from one client with gzip compression enabled and then another client makes straight away another call to the same endpoint, then the second client is served the compressed cached content but in a not readable format.

### Expected Behavior

I expected that the proxy-cache plugin does take the compression part in consideration and returns a non-compressed content to the second client.

Or maybe something some possibility to convert compressed cached content to non-compressed content? I don't know exactly.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. add proxy-cache plugin to a route
2. run curl command with compression enabled
   ```console
   curl --compressed https://example.com/api/healthz -v --output -
   ```
4. run curl command without compression right afterwards
   ```console
   curl https://example.com/api/healthz -v --output -
   ```


### Anything else?

This is my Kubernetes resource:

```yaml
apiVersion: configuration.konghq.com/v1
kind: KongPlugin
metadata:
  name: my-cache-1min
  namespace: my-api-v4
config:
  cache_ttl: 60
  content_type:
    - text/plain
    - application/json
    - application/json; charset=utf-8
  request_method:
    - GET
    - HEAD
  response_code:
    - 200
  ignore_uri_case: true
  strategy: memory
plugin: proxy-cache
```
comments:
I'm unsure if we should consider this a bug or a possible improvement. But we could fix this and there's a workaround.
You could use `vary_headers` to include "Accept-Encoding" in the cache key so they will be considered different responses.
The default behavior is not very reasonable. 2 quick ideas:
1. add the "Accept-Encoding" as the default value;
2. handle different encoding especially

summary.main: The issue is about a bug in the proxy-cache plugin that returns compressed cached content to clients that do not support compression, and expected behavior is that the plugin should return non-compressed content to these clients.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue is related to the proxy-cache plugin in Kong Enterprise 3.6.1.1, and requires consideration of compression and caching behavior.
summary.attemptedFixes: Some potential solutions were discussed in the comments, including adding 'Accept-Encoding' to the cache key and handling different encoding. The issue is marked as stale, but a contributor has expressed interest in working on it.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is marked as stale because it has been open for 14 days with no activity, and is automatically closed. The contributor has been thanked for their contribution and asked to reopen the issue if new information becomes available.

正常

正常

正常，有一点点问题，只能在8卡上启动（stage3），16卡上会OOM，需要继续探究原因。

注释掉torch.jit行 使用bf16 参考 #4339 #3788

这个问题解决了是tiktoken.get_encoding("cl100k_base") 必须访问外网 
阅读tiktoken的get_encoding源码可以发现先使用了hash再去网上寻找的 同时对文件名求了hash1
于是可以
1. export TIKTOKEN_CACHE_DIR=
2. 然后吧cl100k_base.tiktoken 放在 TIKTOKEN_CACHE_DIR底下同时改名为hash取值：9b5ad71b2ce5302211f9c61530b329a4922fc6a4

npu无法使用flash_attention 可能和deepseek同样需要算子转换

repository.name: LLaMA-Factory

summary.main: The main issue is about the training of NPU models, including the usage of DeepSpeed, LLaMA, and other related topics.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires the utilization rate to be high, and the batch size to be optimized for the NPU device. The author is also trying to compare the training speed between 910B and A100.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author has tried to fix the issue by setting the batch size per device, using DeepSpeed, and converting the model's data type to float16. However, the issue is still not resolved.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about the training of NPU models, including the usage of DeepSpeed, LLaMA, and other related topics. The author is trying to compare the training speed between 910B and A100, and also facing some issues with the utilization rate and batch size. The issue also involves some error messages and troubleshooting steps.

issueDTO.title: 🚨FAQs | 常见问题🚨
issueDTO.description:
> [!NOTE]
> Please **avoid** creating issues regarding the following questions, as they might be closed without a response.
> 请**避免**创建与下述问题有关的 issues，这些 issues 可能不会被回复。

> [!TIP]
> Documentation: https://llamafactory.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
> 中文文档：https://llamafactory.readthedocs.io/zh-cn/latest/
> NPU 中文文档：https://ascend.github.io/docs/sources/llamafactory/
> 中文版知乎教程：https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/695287607
> 中文版视频教程：https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1djgRzxEts/

----

### Most of problems / 大多数问题

#### How to update code / 如何更新代码

#### Versions of dependencies conflict / 依赖库版本冲突

#### Supported models are not found / 无法找到已支持的模型

#### llamafactory-cli: command not found / 无法找到命令

Please update repository and install again using the following approach.

请按照以下方式更新仓库并重新安装。

```bash
git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/hiyouga/LLaMA-Factory.git && cd LLaMA-Factory
pip install -e ".[torch,metrics]" --no-build-isolation
```

----

### Out-of-memory / 显存溢出

The out-of-memory (OOM) error during training is usually due to insufficient VRAM of the current device to complete the computation. You can try the following methods to deal with this issue:

1. Reduce the training batch size `per_device_train_batch_size: 1`
2. Replace compute kernels `enable_liger_kernel: true` and `use_unsloth_gc: true`
3. Reduce the maximum sequence length `cutoff_len: 512`
4. Use DeepSpeed ZeRO-3 or FSDP to partition model weights on multiple devices or use CPU offloading
5. Set `quantization_bit: 4` to quantize model parameters (only compatible with LoRA tuning)
6. Use the paged optimizer `optim: paged_adamw_8bit`

模型训练时显存溢出，通常是由于当前某个设备的剩余显存不足以完成计算任务。可尝试下述方法解决：

1. 降低批处理大小 `per_device_train_batch_size: 1`
2. 替换模型算子 `enable_liger_kernel: true` 和 `use_unsloth_gc: true`
3. 降低最大序列长度 `cutoff_len: 512`
4. 使用 DeepSpeed ZeRO-3 或 FSDP 将模型权重拆分到多个设备或使用 CPU Offloading
5. 设置 `quantization_bit: 4` 量化模型参数（仅限于 LoRA 方法）
6. 使用分页低精度优化器 `optim: paged_adamw_8bit`

----

### Unsatisfying fine-tuning results / 微调效果无法令人满意

Unsatisfying fine-tuning results are usually due to insufficient training samples, leading to underfitting. You can try the following methods to deal with this issue:

1. Increase the size of the training dataset
2. Increase the number of epochs `num_train_epochs: 5.0` or steps `max_steps: 1000`
3. Use a larger learning rate `learning_rate: 2.0e-4`
4. Use different fine-tuning method `finetuning_type: freeze` or `finetuning_type: full`

微调效果较差，通常是由于训练样本过少，导致模型欠拟合。可尝试下述方法解决：

1. 增加训练数据集的大小
2. 提高训练轮数 `num_train_epochs: 5.0` 或步数 `max_steps: 1000`
3. 增大学习率 `learning_rate: 2.0e-4`
4. 使用不同的微调方法 `finetuning_type: freeze` 或 `finetuning_type: full`

----

### Corrupted or repeated model responses / 胡乱或重复的模型回答

If this issue occurs before training, it is usually due to using an unaligned (base) model or a mismatched `template`. Please ensure an aligned (instruct/chat) model and correct `template` are used.
If this issue occurs after training, please check if the `template` used for training and inference is consistent. And do not forget to check if the overfitting appeared. You can try decreasing the number of epochs `num_train_epochs` and learning rate `learning_rate` to deal with the overfitting issue.

若该问题发生在训练之前，通常是由于使用了未经对齐（base）的模型或不恰当的模板 `template`，请保证使用对齐后（instruct/chat）的模型和正确的模板 `template`。
若该问题发生在训练之后，请检查训练和推理使用的模板 `template` 是否一致，同时检查是否发生了过拟合。如果发生了过拟合，请减小训练轮数 `num_train_epochs` 和学习率 `learning_rate`。

----

### Training hangs / 训练进程卡住

If distributed training was not enabled, please use the following command to check if the CUDA version of PyTorch is installed correctly:

如果没有使用分布式训练，请使用下述命令检查 CUDA 版本的 PyTorch 是否被正确安装：

```bash
python -c "import torch; print(torch.cuda.is_available())"
```

If distributed training was enabled, try setting the environment variable `export NCCL_P2P_LEVEL=NVL`.

如果使用了分布式训练，请尝试设置环境变量 `export NCCL_P2P_LEVEL=NVL`。

----

### LLaMA Board cannot display datasets / LLaMA Board 无法显示数据集

Please ensure that the working directory when launching the LLaMA Board is the same as the LLaMA-Factory directory.

请确保启动 LLaMA Board 时的工作目录与 LLaMA-Factory 主目录一致。

----

### How to shard model weights on multiple devices / 如何模型权重拆分到多个设备上

During the training phase, please refer to the [examples](https://github.com/hiyouga/LLaMA-Factory/blob/main/examples/README.md#supervised-fine-tuning-with-deepspeed-zero-3-weight-sharding) about how to use the DeepSpeed ZeRO-3 (recommended) or FSDP.
During the inference phase, please use vLLM to enable the tensor parallelism: [examples](https://github.com/hiyouga/LLaMA-Factory/tree/main/examples#inferring-lora-fine-tuned-models).

在训练阶段，请参考 [examples](https://github.com/hiyouga/LLaMA-Factory/blob/main/examples/README_zh.md#%E4%BD%BF%E7%94%A8-deepspeed-zero-3-%E5%B9%B3%E5%9D%87%E5%88%86%E9%85%8D%E6%98%BE%E5%AD%98) 使用 DeepSpeed ZeRO-3（推荐）或 FSDP。
在推理阶段，请使用 vLLM 来开启张量并行：[examples](https://github.com/hiyouga/LLaMA-Factory/blob/main/examples/README_zh.md#%E6%8E%A8%E7%90%86-lora-%E6%A8%A1%E5%9E%8B).

----

### How to use ORPO or SimPO / 如何使用 ORPO 或 SimPO

Modify the `pref_loss` in [example script](https://github.com/hiyouga/LLaMA-Factory/blob/main/examples/train_lora/llama3_lora_dpo.yaml) to `orpo` or `simpo`.

将[示例脚本](https://github.com/hiyouga/LLaMA-Factory/blob/main/examples/train_lora/llama3_lora_dpo.yaml) 中的 `pref_loss` 改为 `orpo` 或 `simpo`。

----

### How to debug with VSCode / 如何用 VSCode 调试程序

See #5337

----

### Why the number of examples is small in pre-training / 为什么预训练样本数比实际的少

We automatically use packing in pre-training, where we concatenate multiple samples into one sequence, so the number of examples displayed is less than the actual number.

我们在预训练时候自动使用了 Packing，将多个样本打包成一条序列，因此显示的样本数量会比实际的少。

----

### Will the training data be shuffled / 训练数据是否会被打乱

LLaMA-Factory will randomly shuffle the training data by default. You can use `disable_shuffling` to turn off the shuffling.

LLaMA-Factory 默认会随机打乱训练数据，可使用 `disable_shuffling` 关闭打乱。

----

### How to enable streaming / 如何启用流式数据读取

We recommend shuffling the dataset before training if you want to use streaming. Add the following arguments to your yaml file.

如果您希望使用流式数据读取，请在训练前手动打乱数据。将下面的参数添加到 YAML 文件中。

```yaml
buffer_size: 128
preprocessing_batch_size: 128
streaming: true
accelerator_config:
  dispatch_batches: false
```

----

### How to resolve `Processor was not found` / 如何解决 `Processor was not found`

Please run the following code and paste the full error log to Issue.

请运行下面的代码并粘贴完整报错信息到 Issue。

```python
from transformers import AutoProcessor
processor = AutoProcessor.from_pretrained("path-to-your-model")
```

----

> [!TIP]
> If the problems still exist with the **latest** code, please create an issue.
> 若使用**最新的**代码仍然无法解决问题，请创建一个 issue。

issueDTO.title: tree-sitter-nim inclusion
issueDTO.description:
I recently stumbled upon aider and read that it "...relies on tree-sitter-language-pack to provide pre-packaged versions of tree-sitter language parsers." Unfortunately, a tree-sitter-nim hasn't been included yet.

I found [a forum topic](https://forum.nim-lang.org/t/10214) that linked to three different github repos:

- https://github.com/alaviss/tree-sitter-nim ([some discussion](https://github.com/tree-sitter/tree-sitter/discussions/2248))
- https://github.com/aMOPel/tree-sitter-nim
- https://github.com/paranim/tree-sitter-nim

Can any of these be included? Would the authors of these need to be involved? I'm fairly clueless on this topic, so I'm just hoping for some pointers on what it would take to get this done.
comments:
Hi there. 

This package is not affiliated with Aider, although Aider relies on it. 

Anyhow, a PR adding NIM Grammer is welcome. 

It looks like just one of these repos is maintained. Id suggest you try adding this one. Contributions welcome.
@alaviss Do you think your tree-sitter-nim is ready for inclusion in this pack? And are you willing to make that happen?

I'm not quite sure what constitutes "ready" in this case, but the parser is quite stable and has been a part of nvim-treesitter, helix editor and zed editor for awhile now.

I will not partake in adding the parser to this repository myself, so either you or someone else would have to do it. However, should there be difficulties in building or using the parser, you can open an issue and I would be happy to assist.
@Goldziher I would love to add tree-sitter-nim support and might as well add the support to *[uncomment](https://github.com/Goldziher/uncomment)*.

@Abdulrasheed1729 i had to remove the zig support for now. The issue is that you added it as a repo dependency, and we cant bundle and pubiosh to cargo like this. 

Check that nim is installable using cargo please.

Okay, I noticed tree-sitter-nim is not on crates.io and PyPI. Though for the ZIg, it's on cargo but the grammar does not match the current Zig doc comment grammar, that's why I had to create a fork and make some changes before the opened PR is accepted.
sorry @Abdulrasheed1729 - its fine to add nim, but is it open source. Sorry, wrong repository.
Yes it is open source. And it uses the MPL-2.0 license
@Goldziher You can assign me this ticket. I am working on a PR in (#56 )
Go ahead
